<color=#ebcd63>已购买的职业未解锁</color>
1.不同账号不互通：QQ/微信/手机号是三个独立账号，数据不互通
2.不同平台不互通：不同应用商店的数据是独立的
3.游戏里的iD发生变化，通常是登录账号有变化，建议登出后更换旧的登录方式
4.付费的职业需要登录才会解锁，因此需要联网

<color=#ebcd63>已完成的成就丢失</color>
单机游戏存档在本地，因此建议：
1.更新游戏时建议覆盖安装
2.删除游戏前在设置里主动上传成就

<color=#ebcd63>手机登录收不到短信？</color>
通常是运营商信号不稳定引起的，因此建议：
1.重启手机尝试
2.切换手机网络尝试
3.联系官方客服，检查是否有退订第三方短信服务

如果还有疑问，欢迎联系在线客服
或者加入充值反馈QQ群咨询：469798099
英文:
<color=#e6c14f>For Purchased but still unlocked character</color>
Please check Login Account
1. Data donot share between Google/Facebook.
2. Data donot share between iOS\Andoird.
3. Please login in with same account.
4. Please make sure your phone is connecting to Internet when you login.

<color=#e6c14f>Achievement Data Lost</color>
Data saved locally by default. So we suggest:
1. Update the game rather than delete and download the new version.
2. Login in and upload data to cloud, so that you can download data later.

If you have other questions, please contact our online customer servise
Or you can join our QQ group: 469798099

中文:
<color=#ebcd63>已购买的职业未解锁</color>
检查是否登录错账号：
1.不同平台不互通：iOS数据仅ios可用
2.购买记录与苹果商店的账号绑定，检查是否更换苹果账号
3.点击“恢复购买”或者“购买”尝试（不会重复扣款）
4.付费的职业需要登录才会解锁，因此需要联网
5.如果无法购买，建议在苹果商店下载

<color=#ebcd63>已完成的成就丢失</color>
单机游戏存档在本地，因此建议：
1.更新游戏时覆盖安装
2.删除游戏前在设置里主动上传成就

如果还有疑问，欢迎联系在线客服
或者加入QQ群咨询：469798099
英文:
<color=#ebcd63>For Purchased but still locked characters</color>
Please check Login Account
1. Data is available for IOS only.
2. Please login in with same AppStore account.
3. Try "Restore Purchase" or "Purchase" button. (Won't charge twice)
4. Please make sure your phone is connecting to Internet when you login.

<color=#ebcd63>Achievement Data Lost</color>
Data saved within smart phone by default, so we suggest:
1. Update the game rather than delete and download the new version.
2. Login in and upload data to cloud, so that you can download data later.

If you have other questions, please contact our online customer servise
Or you can join our QQ group: 469798099

英文: My goods are all fantastic quality at low prices.

英文: It can heal flesh wounds, but will do nothing for Little Red Riding Hood's heart.

英文: An emergency medical supply for dealing with injuries. Restores {0} health.

没有打开的宝箱\n才最好的

英文: I once gave Pinocchio life and Cinderella glass slippers.

中文: 打开盒子后会发\n生什么呢？
英文: What will happen if you open the box?

中文: 本章节的最后一页，是否进入新篇章？
英文: This is the last page of this chapter. Do you want to start a new chapter?

中文: 皇后是不是又偷了我的苹果去害人了？
英文: Did the queen take another one of my apples to hurt somebody?
Who do you want to investigate?
Select the card that you want to copy.

中文: 真不错~！你找到\n了所有的苹果！

It can only be found in the forest.

My stomach doesn't feel so good...
It doesn't seem to have much use…

你对敌人造成的物理伤害+1
下次死亡时重生，并恢复所有生命值

获得2个装备槽，基础行动力-1

每过2个回合，将1张临时的随机反制牌置入手牌

你有20%几率闪避任何伤害
金币+1，每场战斗闪避第一次伤害
英文: Gold +1,dodge the first damage every combat.

中文: 同外婆相依为命的小红帽经常被男生欺负，这并不能给她带来什么童年回忆，与此同时，她也学会了使用头脑和拳头生存下去。每个遇到过她的人都会见识到她用蛮力或者言辞摆平麻烦事的本领。当然，大多数时候还是前者。为了城镇的安全着想，守卫长委任了小红帽巡逻骑士的职位。
英文: Little Red Riding Hood spends a lot of with her grandmother, and is often bullied by boys. As a result, she does not have many happy memories of her childhood. However, she has learned to use her brain and her fists to survive.

中文: 虽然研习黑魔法在城镇是被严令禁止的，但是小红帽的好奇心却无法被抑制，更出乎预料的是女巫对指导小红帽拥有极大的耐心。为了改变人们对黑魔法的偏见，小红帽一直默默无闻的在作出努力，比如使用魔法生火为穷人带来温暖，将凶猛的野兽冻结住减少伤亡…
英文: Even though the study of black magic is strictly prohibited in town, Little Red Riding Hood's curiosity cannot be suppressed. What's even more surprising is that the witch has had great patience in her guidance of the girl.

中文: 小红帽是唯一敢跟着猎人进入森林的女生，久而久之，小红帽变得身手更加敏捷，猎物兑换而来的金币也越攒越多，或许真的有一天，她可以实现帮外婆买一幢大房子的梦想，这样他们就再也不用挨饿受冻了。
英文: Little Red Riding Hood has long been the only girl who has dared go into the forest with hunters. Over time, she became more agile and earned more gold from her prey. Perhaps one day she will achieve her dream of building her grandmother a house,no longer be cold and hungry.

中文: 善良的小红帽不希望用暴力解决问题，哪怕是伤害过自己的敌人。她在神父的教导下学会了虔诚与祷告，并拥有了治愈能力。“比起治疗身上的疼痛，心灵的伤口更加难以愈合。”这是小红帽的座右铭，或许也是她比别人更加善解人意的原因吧。
英文: The kind Little Red Riding Hood does not like to use violence to solve problems. "Injuries of the body are far easier to treat than those of the heart and spirit." This is Little Red Riding Hood's motto. Perhaps this is the reason why she is more understanding than others.

中文: 作为霍普一族的后裔，小红帽很小的时候便发现了自己体内与卡牌之间奇异的纽带。为了掩盖这种超自然的现象，“魔术”成了最好的借口。凭借华丽的魔术表演，小红帽顺利地成为了教堂权贵圈里表演的常客。而随着月圆之夜的临近，小红帽发现魔术卡牌越来越不受自己的控制了……
英文: As a descendant of the Hope family, Little Red Riding Hood discovered a strange bond between her body and cards when she was very young. She sought to cover up this supernatural phenomenon and magic became her best excuse.

中文: 小红帽从小就对自然世界充满了好奇，喜欢做一些古怪的实验。为了照顾上了年纪的外婆，小红帽偷偷跟着疯狂药剂师学会了配置廉价药剂的方法。外婆在小红帽的照料下精神焕发，而小红帽也发现自己能够炼制出的药剂远远不止这些，只要她能够控制元素之间的配比，甚至可以通过药剂影响空气变化...
英文: Little Red Riding Hood has been filled with curiosity for the natural world ever since childhood, and enjoys performing strange experiments. To care for her aging Grandma, she secretly learned how to concoct cheap potions from the crazy apothecary.

中文: 从2张随机事件牌中选择1张，洗入剩余书页。冷却：5次战斗

英文: Maximun health of the next combat's enemies decreases by 20%. Cooldown: 2 combats.

将1张牌转化为金币。\n冷却：6次战斗
英文: Transform a card to gold.\nCooldown: 6 combats.

中文: 隐约中看到一个拿\n着怀表的怪人
英文: You can just about make out a strange man holding a pocket watch.

中文: 前方有一个摇摇\n晃晃的大叔
英文: There's a man stumbling up ahead.

中文: 这只兔子看上去可\n不像一只宠物
英文: This rabbit doesn't look like a pet.

中文: 她的魔法似乎\n还需要练习
英文: It seems like she needs to practice her magic more.

中文: 为了保护正在睡觉的老乞丐，它不让你靠近
英文: It's protecting the sleeping beggar and won't let you near.

中文: 他的脸蛋看上\n去红扑扑的
臭名昭著的药剂师想\n把你抓进实验室
英文: The notorious apothecary is trying to get you into his lab.

中文: 他一直走来走去，你\n始终无法绕开他
英文: He's walking back and forth. There's no way around him.
Is it sleeping? Like, really sleeping?

中文: 你似乎被它的蛛\n网给粘住了
英文: You almost got caught in its web.

中文: 这个人满头大\n汗，气喘吁吁
英文: This guy is breathing heavily and covered in sweat.

中文: 他很疑惑你为什么\n半夜还要外出？
英文: He wonders why you are out in the middle of the night.

中文: 它很紧张，很\n害怕被踩到
英文: It looks at you nervously, like it's afraid you'll step on it.

中文: 鬼鬼祟祟的他正在\n踮起脚尖走路
英文: He is sneaking around on tiptoe.

中文: 张开花瓣，散发清\n香，闻一闻？
英文: It's in bloom and smells nice. Want to take a sniff?

中文: 她貌似正在考虑\n是否赴约…
英文: She looks like she is considering making an appointment...

中文: 这难道就是女巫\n遗失的宝物？
英文: Is this the treasure the witch dropped?

中文: 当心！不要被她\n的眼神所迷惑
英文: Be careful! Don't become entranced by her eyes.
There's a look of pain is on his face.

中文: 伴随着下雪，他的身\n躯看上去越来越大
英文: As it snows more, his body seems to be getting bigger and bigger.

中文: 这块巨石正在故意\n阻挡你的道路
英文: This giant boulder is deliberately blocking your way.

中文: 森林里的动物都很喜\n欢他的魔术表演
英文: The creatures in the forest all love his magic shows.

中文: 异常兴奋的他们\n看上去很好客
英文: They look weirdly excited, but also hospitable.

中文: 他的眼神里为什么\n充满了复仇？
英文: Why is there a look of vengeance in his eyes?

中文: 关在教堂里的恶犬为什么会出现在森林？
英文: Why would the hellhound that's trapped in the church appear in the forest?

中文: 他似乎想告诉你点什\n么，但是又很犹豫
英文: It seems he wants to tell you something, but he's hesitant.

中文: 越挣扎越陷入，战\n斗无法避免
英文: The more you struggle, the deeper you sink. Battle can't be avoided.

中文: 她热切的盯着水晶球，好像看到了你的未来
英文: She stares eagerly at the crystal ball, like she is seeing your future.

中文: 碰到它后你感觉\n全身一阵酥麻
英文: You become numb all over when you run into it.

中文: 不会有错，这是\n死亡的气息！
英文: Make no mistake, this is the bringer of death!

中文: 他抛弃了主人？或者\n主人抛弃了他？
英文: Did he abandon his master? Or did his master abandon him?
It's a huge tree. Wait... It's moving!

中文: 他身上散发的邪恶\n让人直冒冷汗
英文: Just the sight of him is enough to send a shiver down your spine.

中文: 一个没有船的船长，他有话想对你说
英文: A captain without a ship. He has something to say to you.

中文: 虽然没有表情，但依\n旧可以感受到威严
英文: Obviously it doesn't have facial expressions, but it still feels majestic.

中文: 还真是头一回看到\n这么大的蘑菇
英文: On second glance, yep, it's a giant mushroom.

中文: 作为恶魔的女儿，她\n爱上了一个人类
英文: Even though she's the Devil's daughter, she's fallen in love with a human.

中文: 身上飘着烟和\n酒的味道…
英文: An air of smoke and booze surrounds him...

中文: 附近的草地上有着\n一层薄薄的霜…
英文: There is a thin layer of frost on the grass...
The temperature around it is rising.

中文: 他很想与你一起玩耍，想要摆脱他并不容易
英文: He really wants to play with you. It's not easy to get rid of him.
The flow of the water is gradually slowing down.
Why is this owl...carrying a staff?!

中文: 居然有人在这可怕\n的夜里祈祷？
英文: Why is somebody out praying on this spooky night?

中文: 考虑到你的安危，他急于想把你赶出森林
英文: Worried for your safety, he presses you to leave the forest.

中文: 虽然失去了肉体，却没有忘记自己的信念
英文: It may have lost its physical body, but it has not forgotten its beliefs.

中文: 他的双眼紧紧的\n盯着你的背包
英文: He's staring at your backpack intently.

中文: 快看！那边藏着\n一个宝箱！
英文: Look! There's a treasure chest over here!

中文: 你被南瓜军团包\n围，无处可逃
英文: You are surrounded by the Pumpkin Army. There's no way out.

中文: 她热爱大自然，痛恨\n自私贪婪的人类
英文: She loves nature and loathes the selfish greed of man.

中文: 你已经无法分清楚这\n是梦境还是现实
英文: You can't tell what's real and what's a dream.

中文: 巨大无比身躯挡\n住了你的去路
英文: A massive creature blocks your way out.

中文: 一个矮小的身影\n越来越近…
英文: A small shadow gets closer and closer...
She sips tea and look abnormally elegant.

中文: 它愤怒的敲击着\n双手的兵器
英文: It angrily smashes its sword against its shield.

中文: 你在凝视它的同时，她也在凝视着你
英文: As you stare at her, she stares back at you.

中文: 这头熊已经愤怒\n到丧失了理智
英文: This bear is angry beyond reason.

中文: 鲜血的味道，越\n来越浓烈…
英文: The smell of fresh blood becomes more and more intense...

中文: 看上去更像是用\n来过河的浮木
英文: It almost looks like a log that could be used to cross a river.

中文: 这个机器人似乎有\n一颗人类的心
英文: This robot seems to have a human heart.

中文: 为…为什么追捕\n我…不要逼我…
英文: Wh-why are you hunting me? Don't make me mad...

中文: 虽然她一直企图挣脱出来，但始终没有效果
英文: She keeps trying in vain to break free.

中文: 小红帽…快到\n外婆的怀里来
英文: Little Red Riding Hood... Come give Grandma a hug.

中文: 他背着一口很重\n很重的棺材
英文: He's carrying a very heavy coffin.

中文: 插了翅膀也不会\n飞的大青蛙
英文: Adding wings to a frog still won't make it fly.
Do you need an anesthetic, or an amputation?

中文: 前方有一条凶恶的大\n猫…等等上面还\n有个小矮人？
英文: There is a ferocious dog up ahead... Is that a dwarf on it?

中文: 好看的鱼人才叫美人鱼
英文: Only the pretty merfolk are called mermaids.
Is this a bear that can use magic?

中文: 他的眼神里，似乎有\n不可告人的过去
英文: There is an unspeakable past behind his eyes.
He seems to be looking for something.
A man who appears to be down on his luck.

中文: 他传递的是神的箴言还是恶魔的低语？
英文: Is he spreading the word of God or the Devil's lies?

中文: 怎样的枷锁可以困住没有肉体的灵魂？
英文: What kind of shackles are capable of holding a disembodied soul?

中文: 这是一只爱吃蘑菇的变色龙？！
英文: A chameleon's that likes to eat mushrooms?!

中文: 看他，比森林里的古树都高！
英文: Look at him. He's bigger than the oldest trees in the forest.
Wherever there's fire, he won't be far away.
It looks like he's locked on to his prey.

中文: 这并不是亚瑟王拔出来的那把剑
英文: This is definitely not the sword that King Arthur pulled from the stone.

中文: 每回合开始时获得3法力
英文: Gain 3 mana at the start of each turn.

中文: 敌方每回合使用的第1张牌无效化
英文: The first card the enemy uses each turn will be rendered invalid.

中文: 每回合随机触发一种效果：75%造成怪物等级的伤害，25%抽1张卡
英文: Triggers a random effect each turn: 75% chance of dealing damage equal to monster level, 25% chance of drawing 1 card.

中文: 50%的概率不受到攻击卡的伤害
英文: 50% chance of not taking damage from attack cards.
Restore {0} health at start of turn.

中文: 敌人10秒内会强制回合结束
英文: The enemy's turn is forced to end in 10 seconds.

中文: 敌人行动力-1，且回合开始时法力值减少4
英文: Enemy action -1, and reduces mana by 4 at start of turn.
Enemy's maximum hand size -1, card draws -1.
Only take up to 3 damage at a time.

中文: 为对手牌库添加“恶作剧”，数量为卡组总牌数的50%
英文: Shuffle Prank cards to the opponent's deck. The number is 50% of the deck.

中文: 使用的卡以自己为目标
对方回合触发：禁用对方手牌类型(行动，咒术，攻击，法力)中数量最多的手牌
英文: Triggered on opponent's turn: Blocks the most common card type (action, spell, attack or mana) in your opponent's hand.

中文: 仅触发1次，死亡时触发：满血回复，无敌1回合，最大行动力+2， 当前行动力+2，最大手牌+2，牌库添加3张“尖叫”，洗牌，抽两张牌）
英文: Only triggers once at death: Full health restorey, Invincibility for 1 turn, Max Action +2, current Action +2, maximum hand size +2, 3 Scream cards added to deck, shuffle, draw two cards.

中文: 回合开始丢弃敌方一张卡牌
英文: Discards one enemy card at start of turn.

中文: 双方玩家在回合开始时抽3张牌
英文: Both players draw 3 cards at start of turn.

中文: 吸取对方{0}生命以及生命上限
英文: Absorbs {0} of opponent's health and Maximun health.

中文: 每回合给敌人附加2层烧伤效果
英文: Inflicts 2 layers of Burn on the enemy each turn.

中文: 每2回合触发1次：丢弃对方所有手牌
英文: Triggers once every 2 turns: Discard all cards in opponent's hand.

中文: 每回合为敌人附加{0}点毒
英文: Inflicts {0} Poison on the enemy each turn.
You have a 15% chance of escaping after taking damage.

中文: 敌人手牌上限和抽牌数-1，自己回合开始时，并且恢复自己3法力
英文: Enemy maximum hand size and draws -1. You restore 3 mana at start of turn.

中文: 每当敌人使用1张卡，则对他自己造成1点火焰伤害
英文: Every time the enemy uses 1 card, 1 fire damage is dealt to them.

中文: 回合开始时回复受到伤害值的生命，火属性与毒属性伤害除外。
英文: At start of turn, restore health equal to 30% of the damage you have taken

中文: 死亡后变成石像，石像存活的情况下，他下回合会满血复活，且石像的血量无法回复。
英文: Turns into a statue after death. If the statue survives, he revives on the next turn with full health and the statue's health will not restore.

中文: 禁用对方手牌中数量最少的类型
英文: Blocks the least common card type in your opponent's hand.

中文: 每2回合：敌人需要给1张手牌给自己（不能是临时卡）

英文: Like the Back of My Hand

中文: 外婆每回合免疫前2次伤害
英文: Grandma is immune to the first 3 lots of damage each turn.

中文: 每造成3点伤害回复1点生命
英文: Restore 1 health each time you deal 3 damage.

中文: 回合开始对方获得{0}点毒
英文: Your opponent takes {0} poison damage at start of turn.
Get 1 piece of equipment within range.

中文: 将玩家的卡组数量补充至15张（算上手牌，如果已经≥15张，则不补充）
英文: Adds new cards to the player's deck until it has 15 cards (including cards in hand

中文: 敌方回合开始抽牌的时候，随机移除双方牌组的一张牌（没有则不移除），并将卡牌“发现宝物！（id：1118）”置入小红帽手牌
英文: When opponent starts drawing cards at start of turn, one random card will be exiled from both players' decks (nothing will be removed if there are no cards) and a Treasure Hunt! card will be added to Little Red Riding Hood's hand.

中文: 敌方每次使用攻击牌的时候，将获得【中毒】*1
英文: Each time the enemy uses an attack card, they suffer <color=#e6c14f>Poisoned</color> ×1.

中文: 战斗开始时，先进行你的回合。
英文: It is your turn first in combat.

中文: 好战：回合结束时，升级你本回合使用过的牌。
英文: Pugilist: At end of turn, upgrade the cards you used during the turn.

中文: 礼物：回合开始时敌方会获得卡牌“圣诞礼物”。
英文: Gift: The enemy gets the Christmas Gift card at start of turn.
Both sides' maximum hand size changes to 10.

中文: 未受伤时，不会行动（这个buff有初始数量4，每个蛙王回合开始的时候-1）
英文: When you do not take damage, you cannot take any action (this buff has an initial stack of 4, and decreased by 1 at the start of each Frog King's turn).

中文: 熊法师的生命值为偶数的时候，熊法师造成的伤害加倍
英文: When the Bear Mage has an even amount of health, he deals double damage.

中文: 改为回合开始时消耗一半（向上取整）的法力，并造成等量伤害
英文: Pulse: At start of turn, spend half of your mana (rounded up) to deal an equivalent amount of damage.

中文: 双方不能连续使用同类型的牌。
英文: Neither side can use the same type of card twice in a row.

中文: 回合开始时，获得对方坟场的1张牌。（在本次对局中永久获得）
英文: At start of turn, take 1 card from your opponent's graveyard (you keep it until the end of the combat).

中文: 每当小红帽的牌组重置时（抽完重置），小红帽的抽牌上限-1
英文: Deterioration: Every time Little Red Riding Hood's deck resets (they draw all their cards), her draw limit decreases by 1.

中文: 每4个回合，移除所有祷告和装备牌
英文: Every 4 turns, remove all prayer and equipment cards.

中文: 玩家丢弃的牌会进入食人花的口中
英文: All cards discarded by players enter the Piranha Plant's mouth.

中文: 回合开始时，使【护甲】的数量等同于【铁壁】。\n当你的【护甲】被清空时，失去1层【铁壁】。
英文: At start of turn, Armor is equal to Iron Curtain. When your Armor is empty, you lose 1 layer of Iron Curtain.

中文: 雪崩:受伤的一方获得【虚弱】*1
死亡时，反弹受到的伤害
小红帽行动力-1，且回合开始时法力值减少4
英文: Enemy action -1, and reduces mana by 4 at start of turn.

中文: 吸取对方{0}生命以及生命上限
英文: Absorbs {0} of opponent's health and Maximun health.

中文: 每2回合：敌人需要给2张手牌给自己（不能是临时卡）
每当小红帽的牌组重置时（抽完重置），小红帽的抽牌上限-1
外婆每回合免疫前3次伤害
回合开始时，获得对方坟场的1张牌。（在本次对局中永久获得）
小红帽行动力-1，且回合开始时法力值减少8
每造成2点伤害回复1点生命
回合开始对方获得{0}点毒
回合开始时回复受到伤害值的生命(15%)，火属性与毒属性伤害除外。
吸取对方{0}生命以及生命上限
每回合第一次受到伤害时\n敌方失去所有法力和行动力
回合开始不抽牌\n回合结束才抽牌
每受到2次伤害，丢弃1张手牌
回合开始对方获得{0}点毒

英文: Promise him that you will protect yourself.

中文: 这是我们的约定！你一定要平安回来！
英文: We are in agreement! You must come back safely!

中文: 我不知道为什么会\n被抓走…你能帮我\n找到回家的路吗？
英文: I don't know why I was taken away. Can you help me find my way home?

中文: 在你的帮助下，无辜的他终于和家人团聚了
英文: With your help, this innocent little guy has been reunited with his family.

中文: 你因为举报获得了赏金，\n但是无辜的人再次入狱了
英文: You get the money reward.But your report has jailed an innocent person once again.

中文: 这名逃犯由于迷路再次被追捕，是否愿意上前帮助他？
英文: This fugitive got lost and got caught again. Are you willing to help him?

中文: 你受伤了，但你帮助了被冤枉的好人
英文: You're hurt, but you helped a good person who was wronged.

中文: 你看着逃犯再次被抓回去了
英文: You see the fugitive get apprehended again.

中文: 你真的比我还固执，\n都说了月圆之夜不适\n合外出！！！
英文: You are more stubborn than me. You really think it's a good idea to go out on a full moon night?

中文: 算啦，我认输！这个给你，你也要多加小心！
英文: Fine, you win. Take this and take care!

中文: 守卫很生气，你们打了一架
英文: The guard becomes very angry,and you are pummeled.

中文: 你的外婆怎么可能去黑森林呢？会不会是被狼人...？
英文: Why on earth would your grandma go out into the Dark Woods? Could it be... The werewolf?

中文: 你可知道为什么今夜的黑森林如此躁动不安？
英文: Do you know why the Dark Woods are so restless tonight?

中文: 这片森林早已被诅咒，也许并不只是因为诅咒那么简单
英文: This forest has long since been cursed, but that might not be the only reason.

中文: 哎，圆月又不只是今夜才有，看来你并没有认真思考
英文: Sigh.The full moon isn't a rare occurrence. You're not taking this seriously

中文: 你很聪明，这魔法也许\n会拯救我们，但同时也有\n可能毁灭我们
英文: Yes, exactly. This magic could save us, or it may destroy us

中文: 我们曾经也是人类，能\n否帮助我们把这封信交\n给家人？
英文: We were humans once. Can you help us and give this letter to our family?

中文: 你卸下戒心时，他们残忍的伤害了你
英文: When you lower your guard, they brutally attack you.

中文: 生气的古堡三杰扭头走了，正在等待下一个猎物
英文: The angry Castle Heroes turn away and wait for their next prey.

中文: 你通过了考验，付我金币的话，我愿意告诉你一个秘密
英文: You passed the test. If you pay me some Gold, I'll tell you a secret.

中文: 真是孝顺的好孩子，你的外婆貌似位于墓地附近
英文: How thoughtful of you. Your grandmother is near the cemetery.

中文: 我们算怪物吗？这是谁\n定义的？
英文: Are we monsters? By whose definition?

中文: 嘿！别打了！或许我们\n可以联手抓到绑架你外\n婆的怪物
英文: Hey! Stop hitting me! Maybe we can join forces and get the monsters who kidnapped your grandmother.

中文: 我敢肯定你外婆就是被狼人绑走了！
英文: I'm sure that your grandmother was kidnapped by a werewolf!

中文: 我发誓！我看到了鬼鬼祟祟的狼人！
英文: I swear! I saw a werewolf sneaking around!

中文: 你这是干什么？！真是粗鲁的孩子！
英文: What are you doing?! Rude child!

中文: 感谢你的信任！让我来教你真正的诀窍。
英文: Thank you for trusting in me! I'll teach you a real secret.

中文: 虽然我失败了，但或许你真的可以拯救这片森林
英文: I failed, but maybe you really can save this forest.

中文: 女巫经常出没这片森\n林，你外婆的失踪肯\n定与她有关！
英文: The witch frequently appears in this forest. She must have something to do with your grandmother's disappearance!

中文: 肯定是女巫・・・只有打败她才能拯救我，哦不！拯救这片森林！
英文: It's definitely the witch. Defeating her is the only way to save me. Um, I mean save the forest!

中文: 你跟着我也没用，如\n果我有办法的话还会\n是这幅模样吗？
英文: There is no need for you follow me. Would I look like this if I had a solution?

中文: 就因为我没同意帮助他？他们就让我变成这幅模样
英文: Is it because I didn't agree to help him that they turned me into this?

中文: 当然是教堂里掌权的那\n群老头！他们容不下反\n对的声音
英文: Of course those old men have all the power of the church! They don't tolerate opposition.

中文: 我从海上带回很多财宝，事后我便成了小镇的警\n长，现在却…
英文: I brought back many treasures from the sea, then I became the town sheriff. But now...

中文: 感谢你的帮助，年轻人。如果你找到了神父，一定要替我讨回公道！
英文: Thank you for your help, young one. If you find the priest, please seek justice for me!

中文: 谁又能肯定我们现在经历的不是一场梦？
英文: Who can be sure that what we're experiencing now is not a dream?

中文: 看着我的怀表，你就\n能醒来
英文: Look at my pocket watch and you will wake up.

中文: 你被催眠后，被他抢走了2金币
英文: While you were hypnotized, he stole 2 Gold from you.

中文: 前往黑暗森林，你将找到答案…
英文: Go to the Dark Forest and you will find your answer...

中文: 你很没礼貌，但却保持了警惕。
英文: You are very rude, but you stay vigilant.

中文: 拿酒来！我…我没醉…你才醉了！
英文: Bring booze! I...I'm not drunk... You're drunk!

中文: 这下好了・・・再也不会有人敢反抗教会了・・・
英文: This is great. No one will dare rebel against the church now!

中文: 但…顺从，就能填满他们无尽的欲望吗？
英文: But...with obedience, can their endless desires be fulfilled?

中文: 谢…谢谢你。其实，失\n踪的人，又何止是你的\n外婆呢？
英文: Thank you. Actually, your grandmother isn't the only person who went missing.

中文: 神父是无私、仁慈、伟大的化身！
英文: The priest is selfless, kind and great!

中文: 你外婆失踪了？看来我的下场还算幸运…
英文: Your grandmother is missing? It seems I am one of the lucky ones...

中文: 嘘！！不要尝试揣摩和议论神父，相信我！
英文: Shush! Don't try to figure out or talk about the priest. Trust me!

中文: 我只是说了几句…噢不！因为我有罪，对！我有罪
英文: I'll only say this... No! I have sinned. Yes, I have sinned!

中文: 如果没有这些该死的武\n器！我就不会失去家人\n了！
英文: If it weren't for these damn weapons, I wouldn't have lost my family!

中文: 凶手是我？不！当初我并不知道，那些怪物是我的家人…
英文: I'm the killer? No! I didn't know those monsters are my family...

中文: 只有弱者，才会感受到武器的恐怖…
英文: Only the weak will feel the terror of weapons...

中文: 当有一天你不够强大之时，你也许才会意识到武器的恐怖…
英文: One day when you are not strong enough, you might feel the terror of weapons as well...

中文: 没时间和你废话了！我还要去赴约呢！
英文: I have no time to talk nonsense with you! I have an appointment.
Remind her that her hair is sticking up.

中文: 是一位风度偏偏的金发男子…小孩子不要太八卦！
英文: It's a lovely blonde man, but don't you go gossiping about me!

中文: 你外婆？多半是和黑森林深处的狼人有关吧！
英文: Your grandmother? I bet this has something to do with the werewolves deep in the Dark Forest.

中文: 哦？谢谢你！今天可是个重要的日子。
英文: Oh? Thank you! Today is an important day.

中文: 都是因为那个讨厌的白\n雪公主，大家都不愿意\n和我说话！
英文: Thanks to that nasty Snow White, no one will talk to me!

中文: 魔镜，魔镜，谁是世界上最美丽的女人
英文: Mirror, mirror, who is the fairest of them all?

中文: 因为大家都觉得我是女\n巫的魔镜…
英文: Because everyone thinks that I'm the witch's magic mirror.

中文: 不要这样盯着我看！人\n家会害羞的…
英文: Don't stare at me like that! You're making me blush.

中文: 鬼知道！反正不是白雪\n公主！
英文: Who knows? It's definitely not Snow White!

中文: 我们也想要和爸爸妈妈\n在一起。
英文: We want to be with our parents too.

中文: 快去找你外婆吧，但愿她没有遇到狼人…
英文: Go and find your grandmother. I hope she hasn't run into any werewolves.

中文: 如果不是因为教会，我们也不会无家可归…
英文: If it weren't for the church, we would have no place to go home to.

中文: 鬼娃娃悲伤的哭声传遍了整个黑森林。
英文: The cries of the ghost doll spread throughout the Dark Forest.

中文: 快看看我的肱二头肌！我就问你怕不怕！
英文: Take a look at my biceps! Do they make you afraid?

中文: 喂！你等等！我还有八块腹肌呢！
英文: Hey! Wait! I also have an eight-pack!

中文: 啊啊啊啊啊！熊孩子真是比狼人还可怕的生物！
英文: Argh! Wild kids are more frightening than werewolves!
The demon walked away looking very satisfied.

中文: 就差一点！我就可以变成真正的人类了…
英文: Almost there. Soon I will become a true human.
Why do you want to be human?

中文: 我们彼此相爱，但魔女却不能和人类在一起…
英文: We love each other, but a demoness and a human can't be together.

中文: 女巫告诉我，只有人类才能和人类在一起…
英文: The witch told me that only humans can be with humans.

中文: 虽然你很好心，但我想，我和他迈过这一关还需要时间……
英文: You are very kind, but I think I need more time to clear the last hurdle with him

中文: 可恶！我新学的咒语怎么会失效！
英文: Darn! Why won't the spell I just learned work?

中文: 要是能和女巫学魔法就\n好了，可是她住在黑森\n林里…
英文: It would be great if I could learn magic from the witch, but she lives in the Dark Forest.

中文: 发莫尼角夭布窝！……你学会了吗？哎呀你这么笨一定听不懂啦！
英文: Fa-mo-ja-boo-ah! Did you get it? Ugh, you're too dumb to understand!

中文: 哼，我一念咒语连黑森林里的狼人都会被吓跑呢！
英文: Hmph, with just one of my spells, even the werewolves in the Dark Forest will go running!

中文: 要不要尝一尝新出炉的\n果汁？让你体验飘飘欲\n仙的感觉！
英文: Do you want to try some fresh juice? It will give you a wonderful feeling!

中文: 你感到肚子一阵抽搐，胃部产生剧痛…
英文: You feel a twitch in your stomach, which then becomes severe pain.

中文: 哼！不识好歹的家伙！我还不舍得给你喝呢！
英文: Hmph! Too bad for you! I didn't want to give you any anyway!

中文: 你仿佛领悟到了新的知识
英文: You seem to have awakened new knowledge

中文: 别挡道，这可是给教会特供的上等猪肉！
英文: Out of the way. This is high-quality pork for the church!

中文: 对啊，我好不容易猎到了一头野猪，你看这个肉啊，肥而不腻！
英文: That's right. I spent a lot of effort hunting this wild boar. Look at this meat. It's fatty but not oily!

中文: 是啊，高贵的神父和教\n皇怎么能和庶民吃一样\n的东西！
英文: That's right. How can noble priests and popes eat the same food as ordinary people?

中文: 你看着厨师快步向教堂的方向跑去，一溜烟就不见了…
英文: You watch the cook walk quickly towards the church and soon he disappears.

中文: 太粗鲁可不好哦，美丽的小姐！
英文: It's not good to be rude, beautiful girl!
Ask him what he's doing in the forest.

中文: 停停停！没时间陪你玩\n了，我对小孩子可没兴趣！
英文: Stop, stop, stop! I have no interest in children.

中文: 跟我走就能找到你外婆
英文: Follow me and you will find your grandmother.

中文: 这是大人的事，小孩子就不要问了
我可以预测未来，却还是没有办法改变它。
英文: I can see the future, but I cannot change it.

中文: 你瞥到了一顶女巫帽的模糊影子…
英文: You glimpse the shadow of a witch's hat.

中文: 我仿佛在水晶球里看到了狼人的影子…
英文: You seem to see the shadow of a werewolf in the crystal ball.

中文: 年轻人，我劝你还是不要知道的比较好。
英文: Young one, I suggest that it's better that you don't know.

中文: 哼，一次失败算什么，\n我可是要成为南瓜王的\n男人！
英文: Hmph, what is one failure? I will become the pumpkin king!

中文: 谢谢你！这还是第一次有人愿意相信我！我一定会好好努力的！
英文: Thank you! This is the first time someone believed me! I will work hard.

中文: 你说得对，我那么差劲，还有个啤酒肚，怎么可能变成南瓜王呜呜呜…
英文: You're right. I'm terrible and I have a beer belly. How am I ever going to be the pumpkin king?

中文: 你这个没礼貌的小鬼！黑森林里的狼人最喜欢抓熊孩子了！
英文: You rude little thing! The werewolves in the Dark Forest love to catch wild kids!

中文: 死亡啊，也是一种新的\n开始！
英文: Death, is also a new beginning!

中文: 自从教会掌权，我们死神的工作量也大了很多……
英文: Ever since the church came to power, we've had an increase in death work.

中文: 等我喝完这一杯，就让你去见真正的死神！
英文: Wait until I finish this glass. Then you will see the real Death.

中文: 听说女巫有一种药水，服用的人能让我们看不到他的真实外观……
英文: I heard the witch has a potion that stops people from seeing your true self.

中文: 不要……不要打脸！……咦我的头呢？
英文: Do...don't hit my face! Huh? My head?

中文: 我曾经有个帅气的头…女巫！是女巫把我的头偷走了。
英文: I used to be quite a good-looking. It was the witch! The witch stole my head.

中文: 唉没有头就是记性不好…不过这样就不用戴头盔了
英文: It's tough to remember when you don't have a head...but at least I don't have to wear a helmet.

中文: 没有受过伤的人，才会讥笑别人身上的伤痕！
英文: Only one who has not been hurt would ridicule the scars of others!

中文: 嘿！敢不敢和我赌个大\n的？就拿我的金牙！
英文: Hey! Would you dare to make a bet with me? If so, you'll get my gold tooth!

中文: 你输了，付给赌徒5个金币，好说歹说地打发走了他。
英文: You lose. You pay him 5 Gold and try to persuade him to go away.

中文: 你赢了，赌徒嘟嘟囔囔地拔下了他的金牙给你。
英文: You win. The gambler whines as he pulls out his gold tooth for you.

中文: 胆小的家伙还敢在黑森\n林乱晃？
英文: Such a coward dares to wander around the Dark Forest?

中文: 你怎么和黑森林里的那个老太婆一样嗦！
英文: You are just as long-winded as the woman in the Dark Forest!

中文: 我从你的眼中\n看到了“希望”。
我刚才看到她往黑森林的方向去了，她到底想干嘛！
英文: I saw her heading for the Dark Woods. What was she thinking?!

中文: 抱歉，我还得在村里巡逻…不过可以教你几招防身。
英文: I'm sorry. I have to stay and patrol the village. But I can teach you some moves.

中文: 呜…帮帮我…我自己也被粘在网上了…
英文: Please...help me. I'm stuck to my own web..

中文: 在你伸手的时候，它狠狠地咬了你一口，然后迅速消失了。
英文: As you reach out, it bites you viciously before disappearing.

中文: 你收起了它留下的蛛网，也许今夜会派上用场？
英文: You collect the web left behind. Perhaps it'll come in useful tonight?

中文: 它灵活地在蛛网上翻了个身，耐心等待新的猎物
英文: It rolls itself upright on its web and patiently waits for new prey.

中文: 杰瑞那孩子也不见了，你\n先跟我回家，明早我带你找\n外婆。
英文: Jerry's gone missing too. Come home with me. I'll help you search for grandma in the morning.

中文: 这孩子一到圆月的夜晚就会不见，我也在找他，哎…
英文: He goes missing every time there's a full moon. I'm searching for him too. Sigh...

中文: 他叹了口气，忧心忡忡地离开了。
英文: He sighs and wanders off with worry.

中文: 你…你要干嘛！难道你还想再踩我一脚吗！
英文: Wh-what do you want? Are you going to step on me again?

中文: 一阵熟悉的音效过后，你感觉自己变\n的更强壮了。
英文: Following a familiar sound effect, you feel yourself grow stronger.

中文: 一定是女巫…！一定是黑魔法，我才会变成这样！
英文: It must be the witch! Black magic turned me into this!

中文: 它畏畏缩缩地退回树根旁，极力装成\n一朵普通的蘑菇。
英文: It retreats to the comfort of tree roots and tries hard to look like a normal mushroom.

中文: 你这骨瘦如柴的小鬼，还不够我塞牙缝的！
英文: A skinny runt like you would barely fit in the gaps between my teeth!

中文: 老太婆的肉有什么好吃的！只有狼人才会饥不择食…
英文: Ugh. Old meat tastes dreadful. Only a werewolf would eat that!

中文: 臭小鬼，你在做什么！？我可不是蘑菇！
英文: What's the big idea, you little brat?! I'm not a mushroom!

中文: 谢谢…来看我表演的人越来越少，他们都被女巫…！
英文: Thank you. My audience grows smaller by the day. It's because of the witch!

中文: 没有观众，我也失去了存在的意义…
英文: I lose my purpose without an audience...

中文: 你与他进同时进行了一场表演，你的魔术更胜一筹。
英文: You and he put on a show at the same time but your magic is clearly superior.

中文: 看你的装束，你也是魔术师吧？这个送你…
英文: Judging by your outfit, I'd say you're a fellow magician. Here, take this...

中文: 我喜欢这片森林…\n不喜欢村庄...
英文: I love this forest, not the village.

中文: 在村庄里得小心翼翼，而在森林里我很自由~
英文: I have to be mindful around the village. I prefer the freedom of the forest!

中文: 大家都说狼人抓走了你外\n婆，但是我总觉得是女巫\n在搞鬼
英文: Everyone says the werewolf's responsible for your grandma's disappearance, but I think it's the witch.

中文: 月圆之夜，狼人出没很正常，也许你外婆不是因为这个原因来森林的
英文: Seeing a werewolf during a full moon is normal. That may not be the reason your grandma came here.

中文: 这里很多生物都和黑魔法脱不开干系，我觉得女巫的问题更大。
英文: A lot of creatures here are bound to black magic. It's the witch who's the problem.

中文: 哈哈！墓地好久没这么热闹了！是谁在举办派对？
英文: Haha! Is someone having a party? The cemetery hasn't been this lively in ages.

中文: 女巫这几天一直在墓地飞来飞去，难道是她？
英文: The witch has been flying around the cemetery lately. Could it be her?

中文: 可恶的教会！都怪他们，害我要看守的亡灵越来越多！
英文: It's the church's fault! Thanks to them, I have more and more dead to take care of!

中文: 死人已经够我忙活的了，活人可不归我管！
英文: I'm busy enough with the dead. I don't care about the living!

中文: 对长者，你缺乏应有的\n尊敬…哎哟！
英文: You should be more respectful to your elders! Hmph!

中文: 小姑娘哟，你可比道貌岸然的神父仁慈多了…
英文: Young lady, you're much kinder than that sanctimonious priest.

中文: 森林深处有狼人的影子，希望你和外婆都能平安...
英文: The werewolf has been sighted deep in the forest. May you and your grandma stay safe.

中文: 你体内涌动的力量…嚯嚯，你很有天赋。我想你会需要这个的…
英文: Oh my, that power surging in you... You have talent. This will serve you well...

中文: 信念使人更加坚定，你觉得什么是最重要的？
英文: Faith strengthens resolve. What do you think is most important?

中文: 这样确实会有更多可能性，祝你好运。
英文: That would indeed bring about possibilities. Good luck.

中文: 你很善良，但也要记得保护好自己。
英文: You're very kind, but remember to take care of yourself too.

中文: 你很独特，请收下这份礼物
英文: You're truly unique. Please accept this gift.

中文: 为…为什么追捕我…不要逼我…
英文: Wh-why are you hunting me? Don't make me mad...

中文: 不知是因为年轻害羞，还是因为自己的身份是狼人，木匠一直不敢与小红帽表白。担心自己月圆之夜变身后失控伤害村民，狼人打算前往黑暗森林过夜，却没想到遭受猎人的追捕，受伤的狼人最后倒在小红帽的手下...那份心意临终之前也没来得及说出口…
英文: I don't know if it's because he is young and shy or because he's a werewolf, but the carpenter won't tell Little Red Riding Hood how he feels. He was worried that on a full moon night he will turn, lose control and harm the villagers. The werewolf planned to go and spend the night in the Dark Forest, but he did not expect to be pursued by hunters. He was injured and finally fell at Little Red Riding Hood's hands... He didn't even get the chance to say anything...

中文: “传说中只有你们霍普一族才可以解除黑魔法的诅咒，这一直是神父最惧怕的，为此特意在月圆之夜，怪物最失控之际，他们先是让你外婆失踪，然后再引诱你进森林...却没想到你可以走到这一步...
英文: Only your Hope family can lift the dark magic curse. This is what the priest is most afraid of. That's why monsters run wild on full moon nights. First they made your grandmother disappear and then they drew you into the forest...but they never anticipated that you would make it this far...

中文: 原本以为可以在月圆之夜，悄无声息的借助怪物之手消灭小红帽和外婆，当霍普一族完全消失之后，解除黑森林诅咒的传说也就完全不存在了。没想到最终还是得亲自出马，并为自己的轻敌付出了惨重的代价...神父倒下后，被诅咒的怪物都回复了人形，黑森林也不再终年积雪，但利欲熏心的教堂势力依旧存在…
英文: They mistakenly thought that on the full moon night they could help the monsters quietly eliminate Little Red Riding Hood and her grandmother. Once the Hope family was wiped out, the legend of lifting the curse on the Dark Forest would disappear completely. However, they didn't expect they would have to go personally and pay such a high price to fight their enemy. When the priest fell, the cursed monsters reverted to their human forms and the Dark Forest was no longer covered by snow all year round, but the church's blind greed still remains...
Have you seen my Little Red Riding Hood?

中文: 霍普一族在面对黑魔法诅咒时，同时拥有解除与控制两种选择，当小红帽的母亲发现教堂勾当后，选择了前者去解决问题，并企图通过和平的方式阻止教堂的恶行，不幸的是她遭受到了囚禁，并死于狱中。外婆陷入了极大的悲伤与痛苦之中，她隐藏了自己的身世，艰难的与小红帽相依为命，但她从未忘记过复仇，月圆之夜这天，外婆企图使用霍普一族的能力控制被诅咒的怪物反抗教堂的暴行，但终究还是扛不过年龄这一关，不仅仅怪物失去了控制，且自己也受到了黑魔法的反噬，逐渐失去理智。唯一让她欣慰的是，她没有把这件事告诉小红帽，因为她不希望自己亲孙女再卷入这场纷争...
英文: When the Hope family faced the dark magic curse, they had two options: remove it or control it. Once the church was involved, Little Red Riding Hood's mother tried to remove the curse and prevent the church's evil through peaceful means. Unfortunately she was captured and died in prison. Even though the grandmother was in deep sorrow, she never forgot her desire for revenge. On one night of a full moon, she set out on a mission to fight back against the church. However, age was not on her side. She lost control of the creatures and she was soon infected and engulfed by the dark magic herself. She never told all this to Little Red Riding Hood, because she never wanted to get her granddaughter involved.

中文: 勇气≥4， 奖励：生命上限+4
勇气≥8， 奖励：生命上限+6
普通难度，女骑士通关1次
普通难度，小女巫通关1次

英文: Trade with the adventure Card Collector 2 times
Try the Witch Apothecary's potion 5 times

中文: 吃掉苹果，领取女巫奖赏
英文: Eat the apple and collect the Witch's rewards

中文: 普通难度，药剂师通关1次
噩梦难度，药剂师通关1次
普通难度，魔术师通关1次
普通难度，击败一次神秘人
噩梦难度，击败一次神秘人
噩梦难度，女骑士通关1次
噩梦难度，小女巫通关1次
噩梦难度，魔术师通关1次
不跳过任何宝箱并通关游戏
英文: Do not skip any box and conquer the game

中文: 击败等级比自己高1级或以上的任意boss
英文: Defeat a boss with level higher than your's.

中文: 1点生命值获得任意boss战的胜利
英文: Defeat any boss when you have only 1 health
Defeat any boss when you have full health
Defeat any boss in the first turn
Defeat Perist in the first turn

中文: 在战斗中拥有200点以上的护甲
英文: Have more than 200 armor in a combat
Use at least 30 cards in one turn

中文: 用不超过10张的牌组通关
英文: Conquer the game by deck with no more than 10 cards.

中文: 战斗中装备至少7个装备

英文: Use spell card 21 times in a turn.

中文: 中毒/烧伤/寒冷/黏着\n总合达到999

英文: Defeat grandma in the first turn.

中文: 将月圆之夜分享给你的朋友
英文: Share this game with your friends.

中文: 不知是因为年轻害羞，还是因为自己的身份是狼人，木匠一直不敢与小红帽表白。担心自己月圆之夜变身后失控伤害村民，狼人打算前往黑暗森林过夜，却没想到遭受猎人的追捕，受伤的狼人最后倒在小红帽的手下...那份心意临终之前也没来得及说出口…
英文: I don't know if it's because he is young and shy or because he's a werewolf, but the carpenter won't tell Little Red Riding Hood how he feels. He was worried that on a full moon night he will turn, lose control and harm the villagers. The werewolf planned to go and spend the night in the Dark Forest, but he did not expect to be pursued by hunters. He was injured and finally fell at Little Red Riding Hood's hands... He didn't even get the chance to say anything...

中文:
因为她对黑魔法的沉迷，身边的人将她视作不详的怪物。虽然忍受着恐惧和厌恶的眼光，女巫依旧热心用黑魔法帮助他人…

一次火灾中，女巫费尽精力好不容易用魔法救出了几个孩子，却被诬陷是她误用黑魔法纵火。对黑魔法的害怕与谣传让大部分村民对此深信不疑，女巫的脾气也变得逐渐古怪起来，据说有一天她前往黑森林后便再也没有回来过…

“神父说他一直在寻找一个像我这样的魔法天才，从未有人这样认可过我…”女巫喃喃自语。
英文: Only your Hope family can lift the dark magic curse. This is what the priest is most afraid of. That's why monsters run wild on full moon nights. First they made your grandmother disappear and then they drew you into the forest...but they never anticipated that you would make it this far.

中文: 神父很小的时候，他的父亲是一名善良的传教士，经常在村庄传道与救人，门徒也越来越多，这严重影响了权贵的既得利益。他们密谋了一场阴谋，传教士与门徒们都被当成罪犯处决…神父虽然因为年龄小逃过了刽子手的刀，但他的童年不仅变成流落街头的孤儿，而且承受着村民的冷眼，他被当成罪犯的孩子…长期以来的饥寒交迫与精神折磨让这个孩子的身体已经完全承受不住了...他绝望的爬向森林，想给自己找一块墓地安静的死去。\n黑森林里的恶魔治好了奄奄一息的神父，并狡猾的问他：“我能给予黑魔法的力量，你将获得尊重，没有谁能再欺辱你，但是需要你定期提供给我鲜活的人类，你愿意吗？”神父点了点头。
英文: They mistakenly thought that on the full moon night they could help the monsters quietly eliminate Little Red Riding Hood and her grandmother. Once the Hope family was wiped out, the legend of lifting the curse on the Dark Forest would disappear completely. However, they didn't expect they would have to go personally and pay such a high price to fight their enemy. When the priest fell, the cursed monsters reverted to their human forms and the Dark Forest was no longer covered by snow all year round, but the church's blind greed still remains...

中文: 孤儿院里失踪的孩子越来越多，她终于决定踏入黑森林去寻找那些失踪的孤儿，经历千辛万苦，最终发现孤儿失踪的原因竟不是被黑森林的怪物抓走，而是被教会作为奴隶关了起来！当她竭尽全力救出了孩子们，以为又能够与孩子们快乐生活的时候，她与孩子的身体开始因为诅咒发生了变化…无法回到村子，要在这危险的黑森林中生存，只能选择团结。
英文: More and more children were going missing from the orphanage, so she finally decided to go into the Dark Forest and look for them. After much hardship, she finally discovered that the reason for the missing children was not because they were taken by the creatures of the woods, but because they were locked up as slaves by the church! She did her best to rescue them in the hope that they could live happily with her again. However, the bodies of both her and the children began to transform as the curse overtook them. They never made it back to the village, and were stuck living in the dangerous forest. Their only hope was to band together to survive.

中文: 面对森林里的变异怪物，精灵女王更多的是以包容的心态去了解与关心他们，她发现这些怪物原本都拥有一颗人类的心灵，因为受到诅咒被放逐至森林，或许真有诅咒解除的那一天，在这之前，就由我来照顾和保护好他们。
英文: When faced with the mutant creatures of the forest, the elf queen took the more tolerant attitude of understanding and caring for them. She soon discovered that the monsters once had human hearts and they only became this way due to the curse of the woods. Perhaps, she thought, lifting the curse would bring them back. Before then, however, they must be looked after and protected.

中文: 村子里的老人经常给孩子们讲述一些传说，其中最吸引人的便是千面怪盗的故事，传说千面怪盗精通乔装，善于偷窃，经常偷取贪官和奸商的钱财，并把钱财分发给穷苦的人民，是孩子们心中的英雄，当孩子们问起这位英雄现在在哪的时候，老人们便会说起有关这位英雄的最后一个故事，他尾随一位富商进入了教堂，最终被神明感化，悔过自身，不再偷窃，决心要用正当的手段来帮助需要帮助的人…
英文: There are some common legends told by the village elders to children. One of the most compelling is the story of the Thousand-Faced Bandit. The legend says that the Thousand-Faced Bandit was a master of disguise and an expert thief. He would often steal money from corrupt officials and profiteers, and return it to the poor. Thus, he was a hero to the children. When they asked where he is now, the elders would tell the bandit's final story. In this story, he followed a rich businessman into the church and ended up being touched by the gods. He repented and vowed to steal no longer. He then became determined to use righteous means to help those in need.

中文: 曾经是一位充满正义感的卫兵，对教堂买卖人口奴隶的行为极其愤慨，终于等到一天他找准时机释放了那些奴隶...自己却无法逃脱，最终受到诅咒变成成天只会做噩梦的枯树...但他从未后悔，特别是当他想起那些人获得自由之时。
英文: Once a guard with a sense of justice, he was indignant at the church's buying and selling of slaves. After biding his time, he found the perfect opportunity to free the slaves. He himself was unable to escape, however. He was cursed and transformed into a dried tree engulfed by nightmares. Despite this, he has never had any regrets, especially when he remembered the people he set free.

中文: 自己的未婚妻被教堂牧师霸占后，愤怒的他从未停止过反抗，直到有一天他被变成了一只猩猩，被自己最珍爱的人丢石子，被害怕的村民们集体驱逐...虽然它已经不能再讲话，但他忘记不了对她的承诺，他相信只要活下来就还有机会。
英文: After his fiancée was taken by the church clergyman, he became filled with rage. This rage lasted even to the day he became a gorilla and had rocks thrown at him by his loved ones. The villagers became so terrified of him that he was expelled. Now he can no longer speak, but he has never forgotten his promise to her. He believes that as long as he is alive, there is a chance he can fulfill it.

中文: 有一位医生，尽心尽力的照顾村子里的病人，受人爱戴，在她59岁的时候，她的诊所里来了一位法师，法师向她展示了治愈魔法的神奇效果后，她心动了，她想，如果能学会这么神奇的东西，就能让村子里的病人不再受到病痛的折磨。于是，她跟着那位法师进入了教堂，法师教了她一些简单的魔法，并告诉他，想要学习更高级的魔法，就得帮助教会管理奴隶；她拒绝，痛斥了法师，转身离去…
英文: There was a doctor who was dedicated to looking after the ill villagers and was thus loved by all. When she turned 59 years old, a mage came to her clinic. The mage showed her the miraculous effects of healing magic and she was most impressed. She thought to herself, if she could learn this miraculous technique, she could free the villagers from any future afflictions. Therefore, she followed the mage into the church where she learned some simple techniques from him. He also told her that if she wanted to learn higher-level techniques, she must help the church look after their slaves. She immediately refused, denounced the mage and left.

中文: “希尔，希尔，回家吃饭啦”老人站在门口呼唤着孙女，但是很奇怪，平常她的孙女无论在和谁家的孩子玩，都会立刻回应她的呼喊，而今天，已经喊了很久，还是没有回应。最终她决定不再呼喊，端着孙女最爱喝的蜂蜜茶出去寻找孙女，从傍晚到黑夜，孙女还是没有消息。无法入睡的老人决定在深夜去教堂请求神父的帮助…
英文: Jill! Jill! Come eat! An elderly woman stands at the door, and calls for her granddaughter. Usually her granddaughter is off playing with other children and responds immediately. However, today is strange as she has been calling out for a long time but received no response. She eventually decides to stop calling, make her granddaughter's favorite honey tea and go out to look for her. She looks long and hard but still has found nothing as night falls. Unable to sleep, she decides to go to the church in the middle of the night to seek help from the priest.

中文: 世界上总有人心怀幻想，村子里就有一个，他很强壮，但是不愿意干活，因为他觉得像他这么强壮的人应该去当将军，村里的人称他为“将军”，“将军”平日里除了睡觉就是拿着刀和盾牌自顾自的“练兵”，有一天，“将军”遇到了一个机会，他发现了教堂进行奴隶买卖的事。“将军”想：如果自己能去救出那些奴隶，凭借这份功劳，就能成为真正的将军了吧。
英文: The world is filled with dreamers, and there is a prominent one in the village. He is quite strong, but is lazy and unwilling to work. This is largely because he thinks a strong person like himself ought to serve in the military. This has led to the villagers calling him the General." The General spends his days either sleeping or taking his sword and shield off for so-called "training." One day the General finally found his opportunity. When he discovered that the church was buying and selling slaves, he thought that if he could go rescue them, he could use this achievement to become a true general.

中文: 黑森林本来不黑，也没有终年下雪。泉水之灵经常怀念当初的森林，她太弱小了，不要说解除诅咒，就连离开河流太远也做不到，所以当初那伙人来对森林施加诅咒的时候，她想去阻止，却摔倒在了岸边，如果不是妖精女王的帮助，恐怕她已经变回了水滴。"霍普一族什么时候才会到来呢?"   她在怀念完当初的森林后，默默的念叨。
英文: The Dark Forest were not always dark and didn't always have year-round snow. The Spring Spirit misses the forest from that time, but she is too weak to change anything. She is so weak that she can't go too far from the river, much less lift the curse. When the people came and put the curse on the forest, she tried to stop them but collapsed on the riverbank. In fact, if it weren't for the help of the elf queen, it's likely she would have turned back into water. When will the Hope family come back?" she often mutters to herself when thinking about the old days of the forest.

中文: 他从来不喜欢依赖“霍普一族”来解除黑森林诅咒，他认为沉默的村民是人渣掌权者的温床，为此他一直尝试在揭露教堂势力的利欲熏心，并说服更多人站出来，直到他被变成了一头熊...没有人愿意听，也没有人愿意相信他了，但他依旧没有停下反抗的脚步。
英文: He has never liked the idea of relying on the Hope family to lift the curse of the Dark Forest. He believes the silent villagers to be a hotbed of evil. Therefore he has long tried to expose the greed of the church and convince more people to stand up to them. After he was transformed into a bear, no one would so much as listen to him, much less believe him. However, he has never relented in his quest to resist.

中文: 人们总是贪婪，获取利益后想要获取更多的利益，他本来是一个与教堂合作进行奴隶买卖的商人，并以此赚取了大笔的钱财，但是他并不知足，“教堂做出这样的事情，要是曝光的话结果如何你们应该清楚吧！”他威胁神父说道“买卖奴隶的收益我要八成，如果你们不同意，我就会去告发你们！”听完，神父微笑的答应了他，他满意的离开了。当然，他能离开教堂，但无法走出黑森林了…
英文: People are always greedy. Once they get something good, they want more. He was once a merchant who collaborated with the church's slave trade, making him quite a lot of money. He was not satisfied, however. "You know what would happen if the church's actions came out?" he said, threatening the priest. "I want eighty percent of the profits! If you don't like it, I'll exposed everything!" After hearing this, the priest smiled and agreed to his demands. Satisfied with this answer, he soon left. However, while he was able to leave the church, he never found a way out of the Dark Forest.

中文: 一次又一次，他伪装成河里的浮木，撕开那些胆敢反抗教会的人的身体。血盆大口一张一合，就像曾经他手中的利斧一起一落，毫不犹豫。当河水被无辜者的鲜血染红，他会久久地望向教堂的方向，心中默念家人的名字，“你们在里面一定要平安…...”
英文: This powerful-looking crocodile was once a lumberjack. Once he learned that the identities of Little Red Riding Hood and her grandmother had been exposed, he tried to help them hide. However, the church patroller had other ideas. Things didn't end up well for the lumberjack, but Little Red Riding Hood and her grandmother made it out. Now he still waits for the curse to be lifted from the Dark Forest, for it afflicts many innocent people, including his own son: the carpenter, Jerry.

中文: 追求自由的旅行家，有着一颗追求自由的心，他喜欢每天睡醒，睁开眼都是不同景象的感觉，但有一次他醒来，发现自己竟然在一个肮脏的笼子里。机敏的他很快了解了情况，他被作为奴隶关了起来。但是一个牢笼怎么可能关得住一位老练的旅行家，他很快逃了出去，但他发现，自己的身体已经变成了一副铁质的牢笼，而那颗追求自由的心，被牢牢关在了里面..
英文: A free-spirited traveler in pursuit of freedom. He likes the feeling of waking up in a different place every day. However, one time he woke up and found himself in a filthy cage. Ever astute, it didn't take him long to figure out what had happened. He had been captured as a slave. However, who was foolish enough to think that a seasoned traveler could be kept in a cage for long? He quickly escaped, but soon discovered that his body had started to transform into the cage, with his free heart trapped inside it.

中文: 当小红帽的外婆被抓走之时，她曾想去告诉小红帽真相，可躲在暗处的她还没来得及逃跑就被发现了。为了让真相石沉大海，她受到诅咒变成了一只恐怖的大章鱼，她被视为怪物，她只好逃往森林，她相信，小红帽有一天一定会发现真相，并且来拯救她...
英文: When Little Red Riding Hood's grandmother was taken away, she had the urge to go and tell Little Red Riding Hood the truth. However, she was unable to escape before being discovered hiding in the dark. In order to keep the truth hidden, the curse transformed her into a frightening octopus. People saw her as a monster, and she had no choice but to take refuge in the woods. She still believes, however, that one day Little Red Riding Hood will discover the truth and come to save her.

中文: 身为精灵女王手下最英勇的战士，他一直不理解女王为何收留那些被诅咒的怪物，因为他认为都是因为人类，森林才会变成如今这副模样。随着月圆之夜的到来，感受到森林中不详魔力的增加，他第一次决定擅自外出寻找真正的黑手。
英文: As the most celebrated warrior under the elf queen, he never understood why the queen kept those cursed monsters. He believed that it was humans who were responsible for the current state of the forest. As the full moon night fell, he felt the magic in the forest grow stronger. It was then that he decided that he would go out and find the culprit.

中文: 因为药剂师的捕捉，蘑菇长老的子民不断减少，听到手下带来的又有人闯进黑森林的消息，蘑菇中最有智慧的他，决定将族内高手都带出去，“我们可不是书中那些白痴，会将弱小的族人带出去送经验！”
英文: After the apothecary's capture, the number of the Mushroom Elder's people started falling. Once he heard that another person had gone into the Dark Forest, he took it upon himself to get to the bottom of it. Ever intelligent, he took some of his top people with him. We are not like those idiots in books. We will bring some of our weak out to experience the real world!

中文: 小寻宝人的父亲是冒险家协会里大名鼎鼎的人物，在他学会了父亲的所有技艺后，又加以创新改造，发明了许多新工具，可以说是很优秀了。\n但是随着黑暗森林因为存在黑魔法被封闭以后，寻宝者们失去了最大的活动基地。小寻宝人也失去了发挥才能的地方，，每当他背着工具在村中游荡时，总不乏有好事者嘲笑挑衅。日子过得百无聊赖，窝心不已。但年轻的热血怎会被世俗浇灭？当他看到自己的好友收藏家在一个夜晚偷偷溜进黑森林之后，他也留下一封信，毅然前往黑暗森林。 信中是年轻人凌乱的字迹，“亲爱的父亲，别担心，”他兴奋到呼吸急促“神父赐给我了神药，我现在仅凭嗅觉就能找到宝物……我会带着宝物归来的！” 他一边写，一边用羽毛笔搔了搔发痒的头顶。在他看不见的角度，一双毛绒绒的耳朵冒了出来……
英文: Hehe, here's another one! The young kobold had always been fascinated with shiny treasure. His horde is full of gold, gems and beads. Once he heard that the Dark Forest had changed, he became convinced that it must be littered with treasure. Packing up his tools and his treasures for the road, he set out on the ultimate treasure hunt.

中文: 在有关黑森林怪物的传闻中，狼并不算是特别厉害的生物，但狼王就不一样了。传说只有从猎人枪口下生还的狼才有资格竞选狼王，而竞选的过程又是一场你死我活的争斗，最后活下来的狼都有着极为强壮的身体和矫健的身手。因此狼王也常常被村民误认为是狼人，不过它自己可不喜欢这种误解，因为和被诅咒的狼人不同，能当上狼群的头领是一件非常骄傲的事情。
英文: In the rumors about the Black Forest monsters, the wolf is not a particularly powerful creature, but the Wolf King is different. Legend has it that only the wolves survival from the hunter's guns are eligible to run for being the Wolf King, and the process of campaigning is a another brutal struggle. The wolves that survived have a very strong body and strong skill. Therefore, the Wolf King is often mistaken by the villagers as a werewolf, but it does not like this misunderstanding, because unlike the cursed werewolf, it is a very proud thing to be the leader of the wolves.

中文: 世人皆知王国大法师梅林铸造了石中剑，并用它甄选出了真正的王者，然而忠心耿耿又长于谋略的梅林其实还铸造了另一把石中剑，并弃之于荒野。对王国真正忠心的臣民自然不敢冒犯宝剑，而那些对国王心怀不轨的奸佞之徒，也许会在拔出宝剑时逞一时风头，然而注定无法善终----这把荒野中的石中剑早已被梅林施加了诅咒，每到月圆之夜便会侵蚀持有者的灵魂直至死亡。
英文: Everyone in the land knows that Archmage Merlin forged the sword in the stone and used it to select the true king. Yet being the loyalist and strategist that he is, he actually forged another sword in the stone and abandoned it to the wilderness. The truly loyal subjects to the king naturally would not dare offend the magical sword, but those who harbor ill intentions towards the king perhaps might indulge in a brief moment of triumph and arrogance upon pulling the sword out. However, they are fated to meet a horrible end C Merlin cursed this sword in the stone in the wilderness, and every full moon night, it consumes the souls of those that have possessed it until their death.

中文: “大篷车马戏团”是这片土地上最为著名的表演团体，他们四处旅行演出，为各地的人们带来欢声笑语。而会表演人偶戏的小丑则是马戏团中当之无愧的头牌，每每登场台下都是座无虚席掌声雷动。这样美好的故事本可以一直持续下去，直到马戏团某一次表演结束后，却意外发现小丑不幸染上了瘟疫。几乎是瞬间，所有人都远离了他们曾经喜爱的小丑，马戏团更是抛下了他直接选择了离开。失去了朋友的小丑只能和自己的人偶相依为伴，蜷缩在墙角等待自己的末日。就在他奄奄一息的时候，一个穿着教会服装的人出现在了他的面前…..
英文: The Caravan Circus is the most famous performing troupe in the land. They perform wherever they travel, bringing laughter and joy to people everywhere. The clown that held the puppet shows was undoubtedly the star attraction. Each time he performed, thunderous applause could be heard from the stalls which were filled to capacity. This wonderful story could have continued on, but after one particular performance, it is discovered that the clown had tragically contracted the plague. Almost in an instant, everyone abandoned their once beloved clown, and even the circus troupe chose to abandon him and depart. Without his friends, the clown had only his puppets to keep him company as he curled up and waited for the end to come. However, just when he was about to draw his last breath, a man in church clothing appeared before him...

中文: 霍普一族在面对黑魔法诅咒时，同时拥有解除与控制两种选择，当小红帽的母亲发现教堂勾当后，选择了前者去解决问题，并企图通过和平的方式阻止教堂的恶行，不幸的是她遭受到了囚禁，并死于狱中。外婆陷入了极大的悲伤与痛苦之中，她隐藏了自己的身世，艰难的与小红帽相依为命，但她从未忘记过复仇，月圆之夜这天，外婆企图使用霍普一族的能力控制被诅咒的怪物反抗教堂的暴行，但终究还是扛不过年龄这一关，不仅仅怪物失去了控制，且自己也受到了黑魔法的反噬，逐渐失去理智。唯一让她欣慰的是，她没有把这件事告诉小红帽，因为她不希望自己亲孙女再卷入这场纷争...
英文: When faced with dark magic spells, the Hope Family has the two options of dispel and control at their disposal. When Little Red Riding Hood's mother discovered the church's sinister machinations, she chose the former to resolve the problem, and attempted to stop the church's evil deeds via peaceful means. Unfortunately, she was captured and died in prison. Grandma fell into deep sorrow and emotional torment. She concealed her family identity as she and Little Red Riding Hood lived on through the difficult times, with only each other to depend on. However, she never forgot her desire for revenge. On a full moon night, she attempted to use her family's powers to control the cursed monsters to rebel against the church's violence, but she fell victim to old age. Not only did the monsters get out of control, she herself was also consumed by dark magic and gradually lost her sanity. The only silver lining was that she never told all this to Little Red Riding Hood, because she did not want her beloved granddaughter to get embroiled in the conflict...

中文:
他是最近才到村子里的一个外地人，擅长各种骗人的小伎俩，整天摆弄着他的宝贝怀表，说是能实现人们的愿望，可是就连最小的小孩子都不相信他，他也已经连着好几天都没骗到人了。
就在他准备放弃，去往下一个村子的时候，意外地遇到了一个老实憨厚的壮汉。他又开始宣讲他的一切都是梦的邪论，壮汉一边啃着鸡腿一边半懂不懂地听着。催眠师话锋一转，告诉他，其实他们生活在一个鸡腿城堡里，里面有吃不完的鸡腿，只是大家都在做梦，没有意识到。壮汉听了便来了兴趣，问他如何能吃到那些鸡腿。催眠师笑着拿出他的宝贝怀表。之后的事，再没人记得清楚，只知道在那之后他不知道从哪里弄到了一袋满满当当的金币，走在路上都有哗啦哗啦的声音。
今晚是月圆之夜，村民们都好好的呆在家里，正是离开的好时间。走着走着，看到个穿着红披风的女孩站在对面，他笑了笑，走上前，以为自己又能捞一笔了。
英文:
He was an outsider who recently arrived in the village. Adept in all kinds of deceptive little tricks, he has a pocket watch that he fiddles with all day long, claiming that it has the power to grant people wishes. But even the youngest children in the village do not believe him, and he has not been able to fool anyone in days.
When he was about ready to give up and move on to the next village, he happened upon a simple and honest strongman. He once again preached the fallacy that everything is but a dream. The strongman chewed on a chicken drumstick while listening to his words, but not really understanding their meaning. The hypnotist suddenly changed the subject and told the strongman that in reality they lived in a chicken drumstick castle and that there is a limitless supply of chicken drumsticks, only that everyone is actually dreaming so they do not realize this fact. The strongman was suddenly aroused by the topic and asked how he could get to eat those chicken drumsticks. The hypnotist, with a smirk on his face, pulled out his treasured pocket watch. No one can remember clearly what transpired afterwards. It is only known that he was able to obtain from somewhere a bag full of gold, and that it makes a jingling sound when he walks.
Tonight, there is a full moon and all the villagers are staying soundly in their homes, which makes it a good opportunity to leave the village. While walking, he sees a girl in a red cloak standing across from him. He smiles and approaches her, thinking he is about to add to his ill-gotten gains.

中文:
醉鬼虽然整天一副醉醺醺的样子，但他的心里却比谁都要清醒。对于教会的所作所为，他和朋友们曾经也看不惯，打算一起反抗。但他的那些朋友后来都逐渐失踪了，而失去朋友后借酒消愁的醉鬼并没有等到教堂的爪牙找上门来。
或许，教堂并不屑于收拾这个已经失去反抗意志的人吧。
醉鬼虽然失去了曾经的朋友，但他现在又多了一个酒友。那个总是端着一杯红酒的死神经常会与醉鬼一起畅饮畅谈。具体聊了些什么，恐怕只有他们俩知道了。
醉鬼也是唯一一个被死神多次找上门来却还活着的人。
英文:
The drunkard may seem to be in a drunken stupor all day long, but he is actually more clear-headed than anyone. He and his friends were once also deeply offended by the churches deeds that they planned to rebel together. However, his friends began to go missing one after another. The drunkard drowned his sorrows as he waited for the minions of the church to show up, but they never did.
 Perhaps even the church could not bring itself to dispose of a man who has already lost his will to resist.
 Even though the drunkard has lost his old friends, he has now gained a new one: Death visits him often and always brings fine wine. The two of them drink and talk to their hearts' content. As for what they talk about, perhaps only they themselves know.
 The drunkard is also the only person to be still living after being visited by Death so many times.

中文: 他是一个孤儿，还是村里出了名的捣蛋鬼，只要有他出现的地方，就不得安宁。他偷过酿酒师家的酒，弄坏过伐木工造了一宿的木柜，还把守卫的头盔扔到村口的小河里…… 大人们看到他就头疼心烦。某天，捣蛋鬼偷偷跑进黑森林想着搞点野味，未料正撞见教会的人进行奴隶买卖。捣蛋鬼刚想跑回村里报信，却不想自己已经被一道黑影盯上了…… 此后，少了捣蛋鬼的折腾，村里的日常显得乏善可陈，大人们却又开始惦记起他…… 到底跑哪儿去了呢？这个一天不蹦Q翻天就不消停的小家伙。\n
英文: He was an orphan and the infamous village rascal. Wherever he appeared, there would be no peace and quiet. He stole liquor from the village brewer, vandalized a wooden cabinet made by the lumberjack, and even threw a village guard's helmet into the river outside the village... The grown-ups' heads ached every time they saw him. One day, the little rascal sneaked into the Dark Woods to pick on the animals, but unexpectedly happened upon the church's minions in the middle of a slave trade. The rascal wanted to run back to warn the village, but was unaware that a dark shadow had already fixed its gaze on him... After that, without the rascal pulling pranks, life in the village became bland and lackluster. The villagers began to miss him... Where has he gone? The little guy that cannot stay still for even one minute.

中文: 虽然村庄里没有人会魔法，但有个小姑娘并不甘心，她不知道从哪找到了一套巫师的衣服，帽子大到几乎遮住了她的整个脸，还煞有介意地找到了一个闪亮的水晶球和一段从枯树上折下来的树枝充当魔法棒，甚至在书店的角落找到了一本落满了灰尘的魔法书--虽然她完全看不懂书上的文字。\n“哈哈！这下我就是魔法师了！”小姑娘欢呼雀跃着，似乎自己真的可以在眨眼间就制造出火焰。大家起初还很惊讶，但发现她其实并不会什么真正的魔法后也就一笑而过，小姑娘很不高兴地嘟囔着：“也许女巫能教我真正厉害的魔法吧….”\n
英文: Although nobody in the village knows magic, one little girl refused to give up trying to learn. From who knows where, she got her hands on a witch's clothing with a hat so big that it almost covers her entire face. And as if the real deal, she also found a shining crystal ball and a branch from a dead tree as her magic wand. She even managed to uncover a magic book that was covered in dust from the corner of the bookstore... Although she cannot read the writings in the book.\n "Hah! Now I'm a wizard!" The little girl exclaimed, as if she could actually create fire in the blink of an eye. People were at first surprised, but after discovering that she did not know actual magic, they simply smiled and stopped paying attention to her. The little girl muttered to herself unhappily, "Perhaps the witch can teach me some really powerful magic..."\n

中文:
今天是一个很不同平常的日子。它抬头看看天空，一轮圆月在夕阳的斜晖显得格外清晰。它跟着老乞丐路过教堂门口，大门紧闭，它可以感觉到教堂里有一只自己的同类，只是，它好像有点怪怪的……老乞丐带着它在一处人家的屋檐下，很用心地生了一堆火，没让火烤了别人的木墙。
黑夜渐渐降临，机敏的它几乎是在他走过来的一瞬间就朝他叫起来，那是个穿着囚服走路小心翼翼的大胖子，他好像有些胆小。
再晚一些的时候，它远远的就瞧见一个老太婆向着森林里走去，老乞丐也看见了。再后来，老乞丐睡下了，那个胆小的大胖子看见一个巡逻兵走过来，老早就逃了。它目睹着一个穿着红披风的女孩轻轻松松的把巡逻兵打败。然后，她就朝着它走了过来。它看了一眼老乞丐，义无反顾的冲了过去……
英文:
Today is a special day. It looks up at the sky and the round moon looks especially vivid as the setting sun casts its rays. It follows an old beggar past the entrance to the church. The gate is shut tight but it can feel that there is another one of its kind inside the church, just a bit off and rather strange... The beggar takes it under the eaves of a house, and cautiously lights a fire, taking care not to burn the wooden walls.
The night slowly falls. Vigilant, it starts to bark as soon as someone approaches. It is a fat man in a prison uniform who walks with the utmost caution and appears rather cowardly.
 Later that night, it sees from a great distance an old lady walking towards the forest,the beggar sees her too. Later still, the beggar falls asleep, and the cowardly fat man sees a patroller approaching, so he quickly scurries away. It alone witnesses a girl in a red cloak easily defeating the patroller. Afterwards, she walks towards it. It gives a glance at the beggar, and then without hesitation, rushes forward...

中文:
打从记事起小木匠就一直跟着伐木工叔叔生活，他知道伐木工叔叔并不是自己的亲生父亲，但两个人还是情同父子。
伐木工叔叔每天到森林里砍树，他就在家中对着砍下的木头敲敲打打，把它们做成精美的家具，手艺渐渐与日精进，村庄里人们也越来越喜欢这个听话的好孩子。但小木匠最喜欢的还是居住在村口的小红帽，总是在做完家具后去找她玩，看着小红帽快乐的样子，小木匠有好几次都差点脱口而出对她表白，但最终还是忍住了。
因为一直以来有一个小秘密，只有他自己知道，每个月圆之夜，自己的身体就会出现无法控制的变化，变成一头可怖的狼人...
他不知道自己为什么会这样，但他知道这件事一定不能告诉其他人，他不想伤害自己喜欢的人，可也不想离开他们...
英文:
The young carpenter has lived with the lumberjack for as long as he can remember. He knows the lumberjack is not his actual father, but they are as close as father and son.
 The lumberjack goes to the forest each day to cut down trees, while the carpenter stays at home and crafts the wood into exquisite furniture. His craftsmanship improves by the day, and the villagers have grown increasingly fond of him. But the person the carpenter likes the most is Little Red Riding Hood, who lives at the entrance to the village. He always goes to play with her after finishing his day's work. Seeing how happy Little Red Riding Hood is, many times he almost professed his feelings to her, but each time he eventually swallowed the words that were just at the tip of his tongue.
 This is because he has a secret that only he knows C on each full moon night, his body undergoes an uncontrollable transformation into a frightening werewolf... He does not know why this happens, but he does know he must not tell anyone about it. He does not want to see the people he loves to get hurt, but he does not want to leave them either...

中文:
药剂师原本也是一名医生，住在黑森林附近，整日采一些草药来给大家治病。
但随着药剂师调制药水的技巧愈发炉火纯青，单纯的治病已经无法满足他的追求，他开始尝试各种稀奇古怪的配方，寻找各种可能的搭配，然而由于缺少实验对象药物的效果难以验证，药剂师陷入了苦恼之中，直到教会找到了他：“我们一直听闻你对于药物的理解无人能及，想邀请你加入教会，为我们提供所需的药物，而你将会有充足的实验对象可以研究，你觉得如何？”
药剂师几乎是毫不犹豫地就答应了“这下我的才华终于可以得到发挥了！”
英文:
The apothecary used to also be a doctor who lived near the Dark Woods and spent his days gathering herbs and treating people's illnesses.
 But as his potion-making skills neared perfection, the simple task of treating diseases could no longer satisfy his aspirations. He began testing all manner of bizarre formulas and seeking all possible combinations. However, due to a lack of test subjects, his experiments' effects were difficult to verify. As a result, the apothecary became increasingly despondent, until one day the church found him: "We hear that your understanding of medicine is unequaled. We wish to invite you to join our church. You shall supply us with the necessary medicines, and in return you will receive ample test subjects for your research. How does that sound?"
 The apothecary accepted the invitation without a moment's hesitation. "Now my brilliance can finally be realized!"

中文:
他只是不愿盲目崇拜什么人，即使大多数人都在那么做。当民众将教会视为最伟大的信仰，他对那种狂热莫名地产生了一种厌恶，还试图劝说周围的人保持理智。“神父真的那么那么完美吗?不管有没有教会，我们的生活明明都还是老样子。”他低着头嘀嘀咕咕着从聚集在教堂门前的人群里走出来，拐进一条小巷，考虑着自己是不是应该试着找出点什么证据，证明教会也没有那么完美。 
“你也知道神父的秘密吗?”不远处的阴影里，一个声音低声说。 
“我不知道，但也许你可以告诉我。”他好奇地发问。 
“我知道很多事情......”一个矮小丑陋的男人从阴影里走出来，可还没开始讲述，男人就在一团烟雾中变成了一只乌鸦。
在他恐惧的颤抖中，夕阳将出现在小巷尽头的神父的影子拉得很长很长。
他被变成了稻草人，伫立在田地中央，那只乌鸦时时刻刻在他肩上紧盯着他，而他也时时刻刻注视着乌鸦。他们被施了诅咒，只有当他们抓住对方诋毁神父或是泄露秘密，一方的诅咒才能被解除，而另一方则将永远消失。
月圆之夜，他们从诅咒中获得了片刻喘息，开口说话了:“乌鸦知道很多事情......如果你有想知道的事，你可以问他。”
英文:
He simply did not wish to blindly idolize anyone, even if most people were doing it. When people considered the church the greatest form of faith, he inexplicably developed a disgust for such fanaticism, and even tried to persuade those around him to keep a clear head. "Is the priest really so perfect? With or without the church, our lives would still be the same." He hung his head and mumbled as he walked out of the crowd in front the church and turned into a small alleyway, thinking to himself whether he should look for evidence to prove his point that the church is not so perfect.
 "Do you also know the priest's secret?" Said a hushed voice from within the shadows nearby. "I don't know, but maybe you can tell me." He asked curiously. "I know many things..." A short and hideous man stepped out of the shadows. But before there was even a chance to offer exposition, the man was turned into a crow in a puff of smoke. As he trembled in fear, the setting sun cast a long, long shadow on the priest who appeared at the end of the alleyway.
 He had been turned into a scarecrow and now stands still in the center of a field. The crow constantly stares at him from his shoulder, and his gaze is perpetually fixed on the crow. A curse was placed on both of them. Only when one of them catches the other defaming the priest or leaking the secret, can one of them be freed from the curse, while the other will disappear forever.
 On the full moon night, they were granted temporary release from their curse, and the scarecrow spoke aloud: "The crow knows many things... If there is something you want to know, you can ask him."

中文: 自从上一任守卫莫名失踪之后，很长一段时间村庄里都没有人再来应征这个职位，大家似乎都相信，黑森林中的邪恶生物盯上了这个与世无争的小村庄，上一任守卫正是牺牲品，而更大的不幸马上就要降临。大个子海格起初并没有在意，直到很久之后村庄还是没有守卫时，他主动站了出来：“我必须保护这个村庄的安全！从今天起，月圆之夜禁止外出！”\n
英文: Ever since the last guard disappeared without a trace, for a long time the village could not find another man willing to take up the position. It would seem that everyone believed that a vile creature in the Dark Woods has targeted this quaint and peaceful little village, that the last guard was a sacrifice, and that an even greater evil was about to befall the village. Big Hagrid did not pay much attention to this at first, but after a long time without anyone to protect the village, he stepped up and volunteered: "I must keep the village safe! Starting today, it is forbidden to go outside on a full moon night!"\n

中文: 距离上次狼人突然出现在村庄已经过去了数年，但巡逻兵对于其中的细节依然历历在目，那本是一个宁静的月圆之夜，村庄外却突然传来数声凄厉的喊叫，越来越尖锐，最后竟成了狼嚎。\n当时正在巡夜的巡逻兵连忙赶了过去，只见一头孔武有力的狼人站在月光下，却摇摇晃晃似乎承受着极大的痛苦。看着面前怪物的血红双眼，巡逻兵握紧了手中的武器，正欲以死相搏，狼人却蓦地仰头长啸一声奔向了黑森林深处。\n"这...这是怎么一回事？"直到狼人的身影彻底消失在森林中，巡逻兵才终于放下心来，他虽然勇敢但也知道自己绝不是面前这头怪物的对手。从此以后，虽然再未见过狼人的身影，但巡逻兵丝毫不敢松懈，他相信危险没有那么轻易消失。
英文:
Many years have passed since the last appearance of a werewolf in the village, but the patroller still remembers the details vividly. It was a tranquil night with a full moon. Shrill cries could be heard coming from outside the village, and the cries turned sharper until they became a wolf's howl.
 The patroller on night duty hurried to the scene, where he saw a ferocious wolf-man standing in the moonlight, seemingly in great pain as it staggered back and forth. Seeing the monster's blood-red eyes before him, the patroller held his weapon tight as he prepared for a battle to the death. But the werewolf suddenly gave one long last howl skyward before running deeper into the Dark Woods.
 "Wh...what just happened?" It was not until the figure of the werewolf disappeared completely into the woods that the patroller could breathe easily once again. Even though he was brave, he knew he was no match for the monster that he faced. Ever since then, despite not having seen the werewolf again, the patroller never dares let his guard down, for he believes that the danger could return at any time.

中文: 昼伏夜出的蝙蝠可以说是森林中的标志性生物了，每到夜晚成群结队的黑影在森林中来回穿梭，寻找符合它们心意的猎物。不过这只蝙蝠似乎有些懒散，虽然同伴们都在趁着夜色四处飞翔，但它却还是挂在树上无动于衷地睡觉，直到一个穿着红色披风的小女孩出现在面前……\n
英文: The nocturnal bat is considered a symbol of the creatures that inhabit the woods. Every night, flocks of dark shadows shuttle back and forth in search of prey. However, this particular bat seems a bit lazy. While its fellow bats flit through the night, it hangs from a branch and sleeps. That is, until a little girl in a red cloak shows up...

中文: 耐心蜘蛛为什么总是很有耐心?因为他足够富裕到不用担心饿肚子。当他还是一只流浪小蜘蛛的时候，他像寻常蜘蛛一样为了食物拼死平活，直到他经亲戚介绍入住了某位懒惰教士的富足仓库，他摇身一变成了虫生赢家，实现了从“贫民窟”到“皇宫”的跨越。\n腰包富足的他开始学会享受生活，享受等待猎物的过程，以及猎物在毒液下渐渐挣扎屈服的模样，这可是狩猎者的终极恶趣味!\n虽然也有人质疑过他财富的来源――毕竟动物界的大家对教会的腐败都心知肚明，对此，他耸耸八个肩表示，这不过是一门蜘蛛的生计。月圆之夜，他一边享受着美丽的月色，一边等待着下一个猎物的落网......
英文: Why is the patient spider so full of patience? Because it is wealthy enough to not have to worry about going hungry. When he was just a young vagabond spider, just like all the other ordinary spiders, he too fought for food like it was a matter of life and death, until the day a relative told him that a certain lazy clergyman's plentiful barn would be a good place to live. He changed overnight and became the "bug that made it", going from the "slum" to a "palace". With his newfound wealth, he started learning to enjoy life. He savors the process of waiting for prey to stumble upon him, as well as the look of his victims as they gradually succumb to his venom. It is the ultimate hunting fetish! There are those who question the source of his wealth. After all, everyone in the animal world is fully aware of the church's corruption. But he simply shrugs his shoulders and says a spider has to earn a living somehow. On a full moon night, he was savoring the beauty of the moonlight as he waited for his next prey to stumble into his web...

中文: 教会在做什么事，厨师毫不关心，他只在意自己\n的才华在哪里才能发挥出来。他年轻时本是个穷苦小子，为了谋生去做了大厨的学徒，每天帮大厨打杂，做些琐碎的工作，但看着大厨如何做菜，小伙子渐渐也学会了一些技巧。\n如今，他已经是村庄最有名的厨师，然而在这个并不富裕的村庄，并没有太多给他施展才华的机会，于是他最终成为了教会的专属厨师，“只有教会里的人才吃得起上等猪肉，也只有服务于教会才能体现我的价值！”
英文: The cook paid no attention to what the church was up to. He only cared for himself and where his talents could be put to use. When he was young, he was a poor lad, and became the apprentice of a head chef to earn a living. As he performed menial chores for the head chef each day, the young lad gradually picked up some of his culinary skills by watching him cook. And now, he has become the most famous cook in the village, but in this not-so-wealthy village, there is little opportunity for his talents to shine. Hence, he became a private cook for the church. "Only those in the church can afford to eat quality meat, and only by serving the church can I realize my worth!

中文:
大个子史莱姆最喜欢三件事:吃、玩、和家人待在一起。尽管成天吃着鸡腿和一群小孩子打成一片的幼稚行为在自以为是的贵族眼里看来愚蠢至极，但这丝毫不影响天真无邪的史莱姆保持他每一天的愉快心情。 
一天傍晚，和史莱姆捉迷藏的孩子们还没有找到他便纷纷回了家，最近，有人突然失去踪影，据说是被变成怪物丢进了黑森林，孩子们都很害怕。史莱姆直到天黑了也没等到一个人，肚子饿极了的他往家走去，心想着明天要给孩子们道个歉，因为他还没被找到就擅自离开了。路过教堂，史莱姆听见一阵低吼，那是神父的声音，好奇的他躲在墙后伸出脑袋观望，看见神父将一个黑麻袋丢到眼前身穿西服的高个男人面前。那会是一袋土豆吗?史莱姆心想。
“这次的生意我要拿八成!不然你就等着吧！”高个男人怒气冲冲地对神父吼道。
“哼，你想得美。”神父一声冷笑，断然拒绝了他，高个子男人生气地揪起神父的衣领。
“不许欺负神父!”史莱姆忘了自己躲在墙角，见到平日里温柔的神父被人威胁便忍不住喊出声。
神父和高个子男人一同扭过脸惊慌地盯着他，第二天，一群警察来到史莱姆家里一言不发把他带走，直到有一天狱卒喝醉酒忘记拔掉牢门钥匙，史莱姆挣断镣铐越狱了。
“我只想回家.....”史莱姆至今没有明白自己为什么入狱。
英文: The big, strong Slim loves three things above all else: eating, playing and spending time with family. Although in the eyes of the self-righteous nobility, eating chicken drumsticks and playing with children all day are the most idiotic things one can do, this does not stop the pure, innocent Slim from enjoying each day to the fullest. One day at dusk, the kids were playing hide-and-seek but had still not found Slim, so they all went home because of the recent rumors of people going missing, turning into monsters and being banished to the Dark Woods. The children were all afraid. Slim waited until nightfall and still no one came looking for him. He began to walk home as his stomach rumbled with hunger, thinking that he would apologize to the children the next day for going home before they found him. As he passed the church, he heard a series of growls. It was the voice of the priest. Curious, he hid behind a wall and stuck his head out to take a peek. He saw the priest throwing a black sack to the feet of a tall man in a suit. Slim wondered if maybe the sack had potatoes inside. "I want eighty percent of this deal for myself! Or you can wait and see what happens!" The tall man said angrily to the priest "Hmph, you wish." The priest laughed coldly and flatly refused the man's demand. The tall man grabbed the priest's collar in anger. "Stop bullying the priest!" Slim forgot that he was hiding behind the wall as he instinctively called out to defend the priest, who always seemed so gentle and kind. The priest and the tall man both turned towards him in surprise. The next day, a group of police came to Slim's home and took him away without a word of explanation. Then, one day, the prison guard was drunk and forgot to take the key out of Slim's cell door. Slim seized the opportunity to break free of his shackles and escape from prison. "I just want to go home..." Until this day, Slim still does not understand why he was jailed.

中文: 独自生活的伐木工叔叔每天的生活几乎只有砍树这一件事情，直到一次在森林附近砍树的时候发现了一个襁褓中的小婴儿，“这冰天雪地的，谁这么狠心把孩子扔在这，再这么下去肯定要出事的…”想了想，伐木工叔叔把小婴儿抱回了自己的木屋里，当作自己的孩子一般悉心照料，并在随后的日子里慢慢教他如何利用砍下的木头制作家具，大家都笑着说伐木工叔叔这是要培养未来的木匠大师。\n不过一直以来都有一件事困扰着伐木工，每个月圆之夜小木匠都会消失一段时间，问他去哪了也答不上来……
英文: The lumberjack once lived alone and had almost nothing in his life other than chopping down trees. One day while out logging, he discovered a baby in a swaddle left near the woods. "Who could be so heartless as to abandon their baby outside in the ice and snow? Surely something terrible would have happened if I hadn't found him..." The lumberjack took the baby back to his cabin and cared for it as if he were his own. Over the years, he gradually taught the child how to make furniture with the lumber from the trees he felled. Everyone was delighted that he was raising a future master carpenter. However, there is one thing that troubles the lumberjack: the young carpenter disappears for a while on each full moon night, and is unable to explain his whereabouts...

中文: 由于守护精灵的悉心照料，黑森林肥沃的土壤孕育了多种多样的动植物，蘑菇就是其中一种。但黑魔法的到来打破了森林中的宁静，原本与世无争的蘑菇渐渐变成了会吐有毒孢子的蘑菇怪。\n起初它们也只是自保，只要不去踩它们的脑袋，它们也不会到处攻击其他动物，直到一个把脑袋装在玻璃罩子里的男人出现了。他似乎对着蘑菇有着异常高昂的兴趣，在森林中把好看的蘑菇拔了个遍，并且每过一段时间还会再来一次。没有蘑菇知道那些被带走的蘑菇兄弟去了哪里，它们都在战战兢兢地担心自己的未来。
英文: Under the attentive care of the guardian elves, the Dark Woods' fertile earth gave life to many different kinds of animals and plants, and the mushrooms are one of them. But the arrival of dark magic ruptured the serenity of the woods, and the once docile mushrooms gradually became a poisonous fungal monsters that spit poisonous spores. At first it was only for self-defense, and as long as no one stepped on their heads, they would not attack other animals. However, one day a man with his brain in a glass container appeared. He seemed to hold exceptionally high interest in mushrooms, and collected nice looking specimens from the woods. He comes back every now and then to collect more. None of the mushrooms know where the others have been taken, and they all fear for their own future.

中文:
在幽静的黑暗森林一个极为隐蔽的山洞中，“噗通，噗通……”，一个佝偻的身影不断地将一把把武器投入巨大的熔炉中，熔炉的火光映照着山洞角落里一大一小两座墓碑。
他本是一个普通人，日子平淡却也幸福美满，直到一天他从市场回到家，却发现家门半掩着，推门进入发现家中乱成一团，这不由地让他心中一紧，难道遭了强盗?连忙高声呼喊妻女的名字，迎接他的却只有从女儿房间突然跑出的两只怪物，他瞬间明白了什么，眼眶霎时通红，抄起厨房的菜刀用尽全身力气砍向两只怪物，直到毫无声响，鲜血模糊了双眼。
正当他颤颤巍巍地准备走进女儿房间再看一眼时，怪物的尸体却逐渐起了变化，竟是他的妻子和女儿。意识到自己刚刚杀掉了自己最心爱的人，他痛苦的嘶吼着“不！怎么会是你们?”。从那以后，他开始痛恨武器，“没有武器就不会有杀害了！”，他要收集它们，毁掉它们。此后，村子里的武器总是神秘消失，人们把这个偷走他们武器的人称作“武器小偷”。
英文: In a hidden cave in the quiet Dark Woods, "plop, plop", a stooping shadowy figure can be seen throwing weapons into a gigantic furnace. The blaze from the furnace shines on two gravestones in the corner of the cave, one large, one small. He was once an ordinary man and lived a plain but fulfilling life. One day, he returned home from the market to discover that his door was ajar. He went inside, only to find it trashed. He was suddenly gripped with panic. Was this the work of bandits? He quickly called out the names of his wife and daughter, only to be confronted by two monsters that rushed out of his daughter's room. He instantly realized what had happened, and his eyes turned red. He picked up a cleaver from the kitchen and slashed with all his might at the two monsters until there was only silence and blood blurred his vision. He staggered to his daughter's room to have another look, but the bodies of the monsters slowly transformed into his wife and daughter. Realizing he had just killed the people that he loved the most, he cried out in pain. "No! How can this be?!" From then on, he has harbored a deep hatred of weapons. "There will be no killing without weapons!" He would collect any weapons he could find and destroy them. Soon after, weapons from the village would mysteriously go missing, and people began to call the person stealing their weapons the "Weapon Thief".

中文: 原本只是一颗普普通通的捕蝇草种子，却意外在黑魔法充盈的黑森林里扎根发芽，久而久之，样子也发生了明显的变化。平时花瓣张开很大，清幽的花香可以飘出很远，吸引附近的小动物甚至是人类。如果这些可怜的动物没有认出花瓣底部累累的白骨而靠得太近，花瓣就会猛地闭合….几天后，花瓣再次重新张开，清幽的花香再次在林间飘荡着。
英文: It was once an ordinary seed of a Venus flytrap, but it unexpectedly took root in the Dark Woods, a place thick with black magic. With time, its appearance changed drastically. Its petals spread wide open and emitted an intoxicating scent over a great distance, attracting small animals and even people. If these poor souls fail to notice the piles of bones around the flower and get too close, it violently closes up and trap them inside. A few days later, the flower opens up once more, and the tantalizing fragrance emanates throughout the woods again.

中文: 玛丽亚怎么都无法相信，那个村子里最受欢迎的公子哥儿竟然会向她发出约会邀请，她和他唯一的交集还只是那只冷冻火鸡呢！虽然玛利亚也偷偷关注过文森特，为什么？其实也就是赶赶时髦，增加点儿和姐妹们的谈资，而且他帅啊，长得帅就是王道。可玛利亚并不清楚她是不是真的喜欢他，他有点儿太酸溜溜了。她还有些不放心，为什么会是自己呢?还是在危险的黑森林?玛利亚无论如何不愿放过这样一个大出风头的机会，平常大大咧咧从不打扮的她尽力精心准备了一番，还特地在一个偶然撞见的药剂师手里买了据说“能使自己更有魅力”的药水，做着麻雀变凤凰的美梦匆匆赴约了。
英文: Maria could not believe in her wildest expectations that the most popular bachelor in the village would send her an invitation. After all, she and his only previous encounter involved a frozen turkey! Though Maria has long secretly admired Vincent from afar. Why? Probably just because it is the popular thing to do and to give her something to talk about with her girlfriends. Also, because he is hot. But Maria does not know if she has real feelings towards him. He is a bit too sarcastic and self-absorbed. She also feels insecure and wonders why he has chosen her of all people? And why is the meeting place in the dangerous Dark Woods? However, Maria did not want to lose this chance to steal the limelight, no matter what. Normally she does not pay much attention to her appearance, but she has made herself up and bought a brand new outfit for this occasion. She even bought a potion that claimed to have the powers to "enhance one's charm" from a chance encounter with an apothecary. And so, Maria set off for her date with a "Cinderella dream" in mind.

中文: 曾经是挂在商人古堡中的一面普通镜子，但当商人成为吸血鬼之后，它也被商人赋予了属于自己的生命。终年挂在黑森林中的树干上，这面魔镜充当着商人的眼线，负责记录黑森林中的一切动静。然而日复一日的枯燥监视，它也会怀念以前每天都有人对着自己更衣打扮的日子吧。
英文: It was once an ordinary mirror hanging in a merchant's castle. When the merchant turned into a vampire, it granted the mirror its own life. Now this magic mirror hangs on a branch in the Dark Woods all year long and acts as the merchant's eyes and ears, responsible for recording everything that happens in the woods. But in performing the same boring surveillance duty day after day, it misses the days when people who look at it to dress and beautify themselves.

中文: 接到妹妹不幸过世的消息，姐姐几乎是日夜兼程地从外地赶到了这个闭塞的小村庄，却终究没能来得及看上妹妹最后一眼。独自坐在森林的墓园里，内心充满悲伤的姐姐却意外听到了熟悉的声音，难以置信地循声找去，发现一朵人形的玫瑰花在以妹妹的声音和神父及女巫说话，仔细一看，样子也像极了妹妹。\n“这……一定是神父和女巫对妹妹做了什么！”姐姐几乎是毫不犹豫地冲上前去打算质问神父，一旁的女巫倒是先开了口：“唉呀，麻烦事真是一桩接一桩…”
英文: After receiving news of her younger sister's passing, she rushed day and night to this quaint little village from afar, but still could not make it in time to see her late sister one last time. Sitting alone in the cemetery in the woods, her heart filled with grief, she unexpectedly heard a familiar voice. In disbelief, she traced the source of the voice, and discovered a human-shaped rose speaking in her sister's voice to a priest and a witch. Taking another look, the rose even looked just like her sister. "This...must be something that the priest and the witch did to my sister!" Without the slightest hesitation, she rushed forward and was about to question the priest, but the witch beside him spoke first: "Oh my, trouble always comes in pairs...

中文:
活着！这是他唯一的信念，从小体弱多病让他更加懂得生命的可贵。可是明明已经吃了很多药了，为什么还是生病了！为什么！不公平！为什么别人能有健康的身体，而我就只能苟延残喘！
一定是医生没有用，一定是他没有给我最好的药！幸好昨天遇到了一个伟大的药剂师，喝了他的药我感觉到了无比的自在，仿佛所有的病痛都离我远去，第一次好好的睡了一觉。一觉醒来，我第一次感觉到了在身体里充满了力量！
我要让村子里的人看看，我不再是那个病痨鬼了，让他们见识一下我的力量。我往村子的中心教堂走去，奇怪的是每个人看到我都害怕的跑了。当我来到教堂时我看到村子里很多人都在那里，他们都站在神父身后，我兴奋的对他们说：“嘿，你们都在。快看我……”
话没说完对面的人就开始躁动了：“神父快把这个怪物赶走吧，他太可怕了。”哀求神父动手的声音不绝于耳。怪物，谁是怪物？疑惑的同时神父也终于开始了他的祷告：“万能的神阿，你纯洁、正义、无私、善良，你是宇宙的中心，你是万物的初始，你给予我们活下去的一切，现在我祈祷你能帮助我们，赐给我无上的能力，消灭眼前的罪恶。”
难道我就是他们眼前的罪恶？一阵白光闪过，我浑身的力气仿佛都被抽干了，我无力的倒了下去，浑身像被烈火烧过一般。我感觉头很痛，很痛。耳边听到一个熟悉的声音对我说：“睡吧，睡着了就没事了。”
我眼皮越来越重，身体越发的无力，身边的吵杂声越来越弱，只有那个熟悉的声音一直在我耳边，我用尽全力睁开眼睛移动眼球向那边看去。对，是那个药剂师，他从神父的身后站了出来，他在笑什么呢……
英文: To live! That is his only conviction. Ever since he was a young child, having a frail and sickly constitution made him value life more than others. How come I still get sick after taking so many medicines?! Why! It's not fair! Why do other people have strong and healthy bodies, while I must suffer this miserable existence! It must be the incompetence of the doctor,he must not have given me the best medicine! Luckily, I met a great apothecary yesterday. After taking his potions, I felt so alive, as if all the sickness and pain from the past had been cured. I slept soundly for the first time in my life. When I woke up, I felt for the first time that my body was filled with power! I was going to show the people in the village that I was no longer a frail and let them witness my strength. I walked towards the church at the center of the village. The strange thing was that everyone ran in fear when they saw me. When I arrived at the church, I saw that everyone was there and they all stood behind the priest. I called out to them with excitement: "Hey, you're all here. Look at me now..." Before I could finish my sentence, the villagers erupted in commotion. "Oh, great priest, drive this monster away! It's horrifying!" Pleas for the priest to use force continued. Monster? Who's the monster? While in my confusion, the priest began to offer a prayer. "Almighty God, one who is pure, just, selfless and kind, you are the center of the universe and the beginning of all things. You gave us everything to live for, now I pray that you help us, by granting me unparalleled power and deliver us from this abomination." Am I the abomination? After a bright flash of light, I felt as if all my strength had been drained from my body, and I fell to the ground helplessly. Searing pain coursed through my body as if it had been lit on fire. My head was in pain, so much pain. I can hear a familiar voice speaking to me. "Go to sleep. Sleep and it will all be okay." My eyelids felt heavier by the second, and my body weaker.
